text:
Thank you avani..
 pelayanan baik, ramah dan sangat membantu, ruangan bersih dan semua staf sangat sigap untuk membantu apapun yg diperlukan.. tengah malam pun, mereka bersedia membantu saya untuk membawa barang ke kamar..

dapur sangat lengkap dengan peralatannya, ada panci, tice cooker dan dll sehingga sangat memudahkan saya dlm menyiapkan makanan untuk anak.. sampai sabun dan spons pun sdh tersedia

Kmar tidur dan kamar mandi sangat luas
Kolam private agak dalam (1.4m), sehingga perlu hati2 untuk anak, namun ada kolam bersama di depan yg cetek

Yg paling menyenangkan, terdapat mesin laundry dan setrika ☺️☺️

So.. if u travel with family and stay for more than 3 day, make sure ull stay at avani 😊😊

text:
Saya menginap di 1 Bedroom Villa selama 4 malam beberapa hari yang lalu. Jalan masuk memang cukup sempit hanya muat 1 mobil saja, tapi security sangat sigap membantu dari luar gang sampai parkiran.

Proses check in sangatlah cepat, karena villa sudah dipersiapkan sebelum kedatangan. Untuk villanya sendiri sangatlah lengkap, dari peralatan makan, gelas, rice cooker, kulkas 2 pintu, microwave, setrikaan, bahkan floatiespun bisa request.

Salah satu yang paling membekas buat saya adalah keramahtamahan dari staff hotel yang ada, yang saya ingat pak Adhi & pak Nanang banyak membantu saya selama menginap. Selain itu, Recognition Elite Status juga cukup baik, setiap benefit yang ada diperhatikan dan dipenuhi.

Saya tidak ragu jika ada kesempatan kembali menginap disini. Recommended!
title: Hidden Gem in Seminyak Areas

text:
Sangat impress dan senang dengan layanan dan service yang luar biasa yang diterima dari group villa ini. Dari front desk sampai room service, semuanya top. 

Dari sisi propoerty, walaupun kami tidak ada keluhan yang berarti, semoga club anantara dapat mempertimbangkan untuk menambah propoerty baru di Bali yang memang menggambarkan kelasnya karena menurut kami villa yang di seminyak ini yang paling sederhana dibandingkan dengan propoerty2 lain dimanapun juga. Sangat disayangkan dengan kelas Anantara diwakilkan dengan kelas villa yang seperti ini. Could have been much better karena kita kenal Anantara. Kelas service yang diberikan kurang sepadan dengan propoerty yang ada..... 

Sebagai anggota AVC kami merasa sangat diservice dan dimanja di villa ini. TOP!! hanya sedikit disayangkan dengan approach leader sales yang memberikan update kepada kami agak sedikit kurang mengena dihati (dengan pemilihan kata2, terkesan sombong) dibandingkan dengan sales (Ms. Shelly) yang menghandle kami yang sangat sopan dan memberikan informasi yang sangat baik kepada kami. 

overall, we love anantara's group of propoerty.
title: Villa dengan service yang TOP

text: We found Avani Seminyak Bali Resort through Luxury Escapes. It did not disappoint - the service here is incredible! The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Our flight back home was delayed twice and the staff allowed us to leave our luggage at the resort and provided us with a room to shower and relax in before our flight. We stayed in the villa with a private pool which was close to the dining area, public pool and lobby. Facilities were clean and the bathroom in the villa was amazing. In terms of location, it is about a 20 minute walk or a 5-10 minute drive away from the main Seminyak area. However this wasn't an issue as the staff called us a Bluebird Group taxi when requested. Would highly recommend Avani, purely for the service from the staff.
title: Would highly recommend - amazing service!

text: 1st leg of my 17-night stay in Bali. Stayed for 5 nights (15-20 Dec) with breakfast & dinner.   Nice and clean resort with excellent hospitality.  Food was  reasonably good. Stayed in new wing so was pretty clean but a fair way to walk to the reception/restaurant/swimming pool (unless you book a villa with pool).  Great for honeymooners, newly married and tourists who just want peace and quiet.  Not ideal for children because there is nothing much for kids. Fair way to walk to the village (1.5 km) and beach is not within walking distance but they have free shuttle on scheduled time or request.

The bed was really comfortable with good pillows. The staff are lovely and the food in the restaurant is very tasty.  Overall a great place for a quiet break.  Great place for couples.

partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text: Keep up the amazing team work and customer service.  We have traveled all over the world and Anantara Bali has to be the overall top resort and staff team I have ever seen and experienced.   If you are going to Bali as a couple as we did, I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this resort.  Not on the beach which was fine with us. The local restaurants, small markets, and massage/spa's were very close and affordable. no car needed for us but the resort has scooters yo can rent if needed.  We went to relax and we did x10. We did not want to  leave.  There are two Anantara Resorts in Bali very close to each other;  1 bigger one on the beach and this one which is about a mile away inland, smaller and have villas with your own small pool - very private and quite - LOVED IT ALL.
title: Top of the List Relaxing Resort
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text:
My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon for about a week and a half, and we weren't disappointed at all! This place delivers an incredible experience we will never forget. The staff and was always courteous, friendly, and professional. They were always smiling and greeted us whenever we passed by. Even the cook staff would remind us to take an umbrella before we headed out on the days it may have rain. The grounds are beautiful and meticulously kept. The villa we stayed in had a kitchenette and wonderful pool to swim in. The layout of the room and bathroom felt very secluded and secure. We felt very safe and private during our stay. The whole property is very picturesque. The wifi was always strong and constant, and it was very convenient having a laundry room and exercise room we could access for free. 

We paid for the shuttle from the airport and all the drivers we rode with were really nice. There's also a different shuttle that runs to the Vacation Club's sister hotel on the beach. We had access to their pool and facilities, their beachfront, and of course we ate at their restaurant too. It was like staying at 2 hotels for the price of 1! The front desk always kept our interests in mind when helping us choose excursions during our stay. We ended up doing the Uluwatu package and it was incredible. 

But my wife and I both agree that our favorite activity was the cooking class! Their chef taught us how to cook a traditional Balinese dinner and showed us the ingredients used. I even picked up some techniques to use back at home. It was a fun and rewarding experience well worth the price. They even gave us certificates, aprons, and a cutting board to take home with us. 

Overall, everything we experienced was perfect. We ordered room service multiple times and we satisfied every time. We loved our stay here, and will most definitely be coming back and recommending the Vacation Club to friends and family. Well done.
title: Honeymoon Destination

text:
Kids enjoy a lot especially the privacy and swimming pools 
Wife like the Balinese ambiance
Great services provided by staff of Anantara
No hard selling
15-20mins walk to Seminyak beach but Anantara provide free shuttle to beach at 3 different timing.

Overall: A great place to spend with family.
title: Great place to stay with kids

text: If you are going to travel to Bali and want a “true” Bali experience rather than the typical hotel resort, this is the place to stay!   My husband and I had a one bedroom pool villa and from the private pool and courtyard to the separate MBR/Bath and living/kitchen area to the indoor/outdoor showers........everything was so unique and authentic.   Then there are the staff, who treat you like family and are so warm and welcoming!  We absolutely loved this place and would highly recommend it to anyone that wants to have a more authentic Bali experience.
title: A TRUE BALI EXPERIENCE

text: Great place, very private, good food if you want to order any, loved the little pool, loved the bedroom, loved the bathroom, the kitchen room in the middle could do with some work to make it a bit nicer, a few simple things, badly designed compared to the rest of the place. I would go back.
title: Great Place

text:
I’m a little behind on my Bali reviews but I had to write about Anantara Vacation Club before it was too late...the stay was AMAZING! The accommodations were wonderful, the bed was comfy, the outdoor shower divine, and the private pool offered even more luxury. They have a restaurant on site if you want to eat in or you can order to your room. The staff was so friendly however that we preferred to enjoy our meals/snacks at the dining area. While the location of this accommodation isn’t on the beach they offer convenient transfers to their sister property which is beach front. You can also use the facilities at the other property if you want to say, have lunch by the infinity pool before walking along the beach. AVC however is in a good location, walking distance to plenty of shops and restaurants. 

Also can I just say it again...the staff was fabulous and made us feel right at home and welcomed. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
title: Wonderful Oasis

text: The Resort was clean and the facilities in Excellent condition. The staff were very very friendly and extremely helpful. We stayed in the 1 Bedroom Villa and while we were out for the day, the Villa was neatly made up again; A/C blowing and lights were switched on for us in the evening when we returned. When using the Main Pool, the towels were neatly put out and included Sun Screen. Our 2 year old had fun with the inflatables provided by the resort. Overall a GREAT Experience and we will definitely be back again!!
title: Fun Family Holiday!!!

text:
Arrived in Seminyak, a bustling frenetic city packed with cars and scooters with my niece and her boyfriend who had been backpacking Southeast Asia. Turned off the main street to a long drive leading to a quiet and serene environment. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The 1 bedroom villa at Anantara was perfect for our group. 1 separate large room with very comfy king bed and huge bathroom with both indoor and outdoor shower. Then a separate small building with a kitchen and a convertible couch bed that was reported to be amazing. Had it's own small full bathroom. Pillows and linens were way better than expected. Kitchen was well appointed. AC worked very well in each room. Our villa had it's own private pool. What an extravagance! Also a nice main pool with cabanas. 
Walking distance to shopping, food and the beach. (20 minutes) 
Room service was pretty good but eggs were lukewarm by arrival. Staff attended to our needs. All together a wonderful relaxing week.
title: A calm respite in a busy city

text:
Anantara was amazing!  It was my first trip to Bali and this was my first accommodation in Bali.  I felt 100% welcomed.  The staff was kind and learned my name immediately.  My friend joined me a few days later.  I had set-up an airport transport for her with the front desk the day before.  The next day, a different person commented that I must be excited that Ms. Kristin was joining me today.  

I was a high maintenance guest.  I asked them a ton of questions about the area, getting around, etc.  They were always willing to help.

I loved having a private pool!  With the heavy heat and humidity, I found myself constantly going into the pool to cool off.

They offered a shuttle to the Anantara Beach Resort.  I'm so glad we did that. Their pool was magnificent and it was right on the water.  They had security that stopped people from coming up and bothering us.  At night, they had S.O.S.:  Sunset on Seminyak where they had happy hour type deals for food and drink and bean bag chairs facing the sunset.

Excellent experience!
title: Peaceful and Hospitable

text: First time to Bali. All I can say of the area of Seminyak is organized chaos! This gem is set way back from the street and is a collection of 1, 2 and 3 bedroom private villas. We had a 1 bedroom villa for my family. Ours was 2 separate buildings with a private pool in the courtyard. One is a bedroom with attached bathroom, tub and shower and the other is living room/kitchen which has a sofa bed for my son. the second 3/4 bath is all by itself accessed from a door in the courtyard. We loved it. EVERY single employee we came across in our stay was helpful and nice... and with so few villas they all knew us by name from the first day. Can't wait to go back.
title: Calm, tranquil oasis.

text:
We stayed for a week in a one bedroom villa at the Anantara Vacation Club.  The villa was very well appointed with a really comfortable bed, spacious bathroom (with a good shower and a large tub), a private garden with pool and a living area with a small kitchen.  For privacy the villa was amazing and the design meant that there were cool shady areas during the heat of the day.  The living area and bedroom were at either end of the garden (in the Balinese style). The pool was deep enough to swim easily, or to stand shoulder deep in cool waters. The villa was quiet and relaxing, although the bustling heart of Seminyak was less than 10 minutes walk away.

The staff at the resort were incredibly helpful and friendly, everyone said hello and asked how we were, many would stop for a chat to ask more about our stay in Bali and to ensure we were enjoying ourselves.  Two of the organised activities which we would strongly recommend are the temple visit and the cooking course.  These provide an amazing insight into Balinese culture and help to really appreciate the island.
title: Quiet, romantic stay in a bustling part of Bali

text:
Great stay! The area in which the hotel is located is great, only a few minutes walk to lots of shops, restaurants and bars. 
The hotel was private and felt worlds away from the crazy outside world. 
The rooms were wonderful, they were spacious, clean and had everything could have needed. The pool and outdoor sitting area was also great for a lazy day in the sun. The rooms were quiet and as soon as you walk through the villa door you feel relaxed. 
We only ate breakfast within the hotel but could not fault it, was delicious. 
Really happy with our stay and would come back, great value for money.

text:
This is truly a beautiful place - an oasis in the madness that is Seminyak!
It's what you expect of Bali upon arrival. The staff is endlessly helpful and gracious. My villa had things that make me feel so at home - a nice bathtub and a swimming pool I can step into from my doorstep with complete privacy.
It looked fabulously Balinese, and the bed was comfortable. Amenities and towels were lovely. I would give this place a 5, except that some of the aspects were so very tired. I like to use my kitchen, but this one was so very old and tired. On the plus side, there is an espresso maker in the kitchen!
I came here as part of my Hilton Grand Vacations plan, so wasn't completely a member. (so no breakfast for me.) But the dining room looked fantastic. 
You can see that there is a lotto pride in keeping this property up to great standards.
title: A Lovely Private Pool is the Crown

text:
The place is nice and the villa provides a great place to stay.  I love the privacy of having your own pool and the enclosed area.

We were greeted by Santi on arrival and she was so professional and very helpful.  I wish everyone was like her.  Unfortunately not everyone is like her and other staff should learn from her.  We have different experience from different staff.  Others would greet you when you get back to the villa whilst others ignores you.  There was another guy in reception who was nice and offered to call our driver as we were waiting at 0130 hrs in the morning for a sunrise trek... he was very helpful but unfortunately I didn't manage to get his name. 

On our last night We requested for a late check out for the next day as our flight was at 1840hrs but they could not accommodate us as we were told they are fully booked.

We ordered cocktails on our last night and we waited almost half an hour for it to be delivered in our villa.  They were not that great either. I had better cocktails outside the hotel.

In summary, I still like the place but they could have at least taken that extra mile to accommodate some of the needs of the guest... after all, what's another extra hour to compromise for a late check out... it does dampen the good experience you had and felt like since it is your last day, they can't be bothered to accommodate a small request.
title: Nice place but could have taken that extra mile...

text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with it's own pool, which was ideal as the main pool was too warm to swim in as it was exposed to the sun all day.  There are basic cooking facilities and access to a shared laundry. Staff were so kind and friendly, nothing was too much trouble for them to help with.  I highly recommend this for families as it is hot in Bali, all the kids wanted to do was swim all day, and we could do this in the comfort of our own complex complete with it's own large gardens.  Management pre-empted our stay and some very thoughtful gestures to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable.  The street is quiet but is a short easy walk to the coffee shop and the main streets without being noisy.

text: Try not to compare a vacation club with a hotel.  Hotels are normally eye catching in different ways.  But it is not necessary for vacation clubs.   This is the first time we visit Bali and this club is located along a small alley which is hard to notice especially we arrived very late at night.   I have booked a one bedroom villa and I have no complain about the room itself.  There is a courtyard between the bedroom and living room where the tiny swimming pool is located.  There is also a tree planted at the lawn which is exactly what you can see from their website.  this place itself is so peaceful and if you are looking for activities, they are just few steps away from the club.  Staff are very friendly and helpful.  Club provides free bicycles, nice touch.
title: Definition of Vacation club

text:
The hotel is in Seminyak, in a much quieter part of the area. There are lots of restaurants, massage place, motorcycle rentals, tour agencies, convenient stores and warungs (local food place) near the hotel. Unfortunately, the beach is around 15 minute walk from the hotel. There is a 3 times a day shuttle to/from the hotel to its sister hotel right by the beach (Anantara Bali Seminyak). 

The hotel itself has a very nice ambience. Small and cozy. It has everything you need, including the very friendly and accommodating staffs. The layout of our one bedroom villa takes inspiration from a typical Bali house layout, the bedroom and main bathroom is in a unit separate from the living room and kitchen. There is a swimming pool in each villa. 

Ameneties are complete - just call them if some toiletry items are not in your room; the kitchen is also stocked with commonly used appliances, cooking tools, plates, and cutleries. The internet is also fast, compared to Indonesian standard. 

Over-all, it was a cozy and charming place to stay at while in Bali.
title: Perfect base to explore Bali

text:
I only managed to stay and book a 2 bedroom pool villa and 1 bedroom pool villa for 2 nights. Wanted to book the 3 bedroom pool villa for 3 nights but it was fully booked and it was like 3 months in advance. 
Anywaes we made do with our 2 nights booking.

Location:
The name Anantara itself, people knew it to be a big and luxurious hotel chain but for this property, it doesn’t really show. To get to the place, we had to go through a narrow 2 way road and we had to really open our eyes to see the small sign board directing the place. When we spotted the sign, we had to turn and go through another narrow road that will eventually leads to wat looked like a dead end. Anantara staff will be there directing the small amount of parking lots. There are no those usual big Anantara brand signage on the wall of the entrance. U really need to have a vehicle to travel around here as to get to the main road, u will at least need to walk more than 15mins. This is really shocking that before entering the property, u dun have that wow feeling. Even those guest that ive brought along dun have the impressed feeling. They thought I had booked some budget villa.

Property outlook:
There is only one small entrance door which u dun really expect that form and well known brand. When we step in, the first thing we saw was the small check in lobby. It still dun have the impressed feeling. Just less than 10 steps from the door is the lobby. I looked around and just another few steps is the public swimming pool. It looks quite small and it doesn’t justify itself from the photos in the website. Just beside the swimming pool is the restaurant. There is only 1 restaurant in this property and it looked really small and empty. 
The property also looked really empty as for the 3 days ive stayed, I can count the no. of people with my 2 hands. Wonder why or how the 3 bedroom and 2 bedroom villa is not available.

Villa outlook:
Ill talk about the 1 bedroom villa first. Ive requested that ill be having 4 guest in the 1 bedroom villa so they took the initiative to provide a double bed instead of the sofa at the so called living room. The living room look like a normal room with the wall replaced with floor to ceiling glass panel and of coz they have blinds to bring down for privacy. Well from the feedback I got, at night, they will be some insects entering that room maybe because of the small gap below the door. Anywaes, the living room is equipped with television and air condition.
Beside the living room, there is a small toilet combined together with the shower area. It didn’t looked like a bathroom as there are no sign on the door. We thought it was a service duct for the main switch board. We only discovered that it was a bathroom on the 2nd day. 
In the so called middle of the villa is the private swimming pool. U have to call the front desk to open the circulation and so called Jacuzzi function of the swimming pool after 4. Well the swimming pool can get quite dirty with leaves and flowers and branch tweaks falling from the plantation and tree surrounding it. So before every swim, we have to literally clean up the swimming pool.
Then at the other end of the villa is the master bedroom. They have all the standard items like tv air con safe box etc..in the room. Bed is king size and it’s a little hard with very soft pillows not that to most of our likings. The bed is surrounded by mosquito netting which when not in use, it could be places at each corner of the bed which of coz needs the string to tie it nicely to one corner or else it would just come back to the center. This is good to prevent mosquito but the bad thing about this is that only one person could watch the tv when lying down. The tv is place at one corner where if someone lie down on one side of the bed, he wont get to see the tv screen as one side of the mosquito netting is obstructing the view.
Anywaes in the cupboard, they even provide a shopping basket for us to use.

Bathroom:
The bath room is huge. They have 4 sections to the bathroom. One for the bathtub cum basin area, one for the toilet (doing business) area, one for the showering area and one for the god knows wat area is that.
The bathtub is huge and there is a glass window where the swimming pool view could be seen when ure in the bathtub and of coz theres blinds for privacy. Their toiletries as those normal basic ones with the additional of the sea salt bath for soaking in the bath tub. There is a looked like wooden ladder which they say is to hang the towels. Well it looks stylish and something new but I dun think hanging more than 1 towel is effective to let it dry as the steps are near to one another so the top towel will be coving most of the bottom towel. 
Next is the shower area. I seriously dun like Anantara shampoo as it’s the jasmine smell as to me it personally will make me headache as the smell Is too strong. They should have a system where u could choose the shampoo before checking in.
They have the rainbath which nowadays most hotels would provide it. Behind the shower area is a door leading to the god knows what room is that area which I will touch on it later.

For the toilet area, it just a small room for u to do the business with frosted door for privacy but with one floor to ceiling glass wall which I really dun understand the whole concept as u can literally see the god knows what area and form the back door of the showering area, u could literally walk to the god know what area and to the glass panel of the toilet and see thru it. There is seriously no privacy.

Okie now for the god knows wat area is that. It occupies the back of the toilet and shower room. The floor is slippery and there is this like bamboo pipe above for showering. From my first view, it looked like the shower area before entering the swimming pool. But there is no access to the swimming pool at all. I seriously dunno what concept are they trying to create. Doing business in the toilet at night could also be creepy as u can look thru the glass wall to that area which is opened to the sky.

Anywaes, for the two bedroom villa, its practically the same, only with two bedrooms with the same things and the living room in the middle. To go to one room to the other is so troublesome. U need to wear the slippers, open the sliding door to enter the living room then open another sliding door to exit the living room.
The private swimming pool is bigger maybe 1 ½ times the size of the 1 bedroom villa.

Anywaes, we were so lucky to get the villa near the lobby area as when we tried to explore the place, we had to walk so far to reach the end and even when we reach the end we cant see the 3 bedroom villa. Maybe theres a secret door. It would be really scary to walk at night to the furtherst end if ure unlucky enough to book it as its like walking through a jungle.

Facilities:
There is a gym and washing machine area. I tried to enter the gym but as I enter, it was so hot. Maybe need to switch on the air con myself.
For the washing machine area, I think it’s a really bad idea as everyone is able to use it. I would prefer individual villa having their own washing machine area. I did use the washing machine and it was at night. As there are only 2 small washing machines and 2 dryer, With a lot of clothes, I had to use 2 washing machine. Then have to go back to my villa which is quite far, wait for an hour or so , go back to the washing machine to transfer to the dryer, go back to the villa to wait for around 2 hours for the clothes to dry at the dryer. And all these process took me till 2am. Even that the clothes did not dry so I tot tmr morning I would put in the dryer again. So the next morning I did as I wanted to but after 2 hours, all my clothes are chucked to one side in the basket still wet and other guest clothes are now in the dryer. I guess my clothes are in there less than 10 minutes for other guest to take it out for their own use. Very evil guest. So that is why I suggest that each villa should have their own washing machine and dryer.

Service:
Service is practically excellent as per usual of Anantara standard. From checking in to our stay and checking out, the service of the front desk to the staffs are excellent. This is the only reason where the star rating brings up the property.

Conclusion: 
As ive mention, only the service and the size of the villa are worth mentioning or rating. The rest are really a big disappointment from and Anantara brand. As first impression is always important and the luxurious image is important, there should really be a big change for them to create awareness to other people.
Even though the service is excellent and up to standard of 5 or even 6 star property, but there are too many things on this property that made me really  torn whether to return to this villa the next time I come to Bali.
title: High expectation or Over expectation

text:
it is a late review for my stay in this hotel in Jan 2015.  While the villa and facilities are relatively small compared to other anantara properties in Thailand, but it is relaxing. I am not bothered much by mosquitos  And clients can use the larger pool and beach in nearby Anantara seminyak hotel, there are free shuttle bus between the 2 hotels 3 times a day I think.

Then, this is what happened to me in my third day in Bali.

My wife and I went to nearby Anantara Seminyak Hotel to enjoy our afternoon. Early that morning, we saw some kids surfing in the beach. It seemed to be fun. The water is shallow, despite the windy weather and a bit of waves. 

Even though, we have never done surfing before, and we only know frog swimming, we rented two surfing board and went in.  Initially, the water is only on our knee, we tried a few time, but could not ride the wave, and after a few failure, we find the wave have actually pull us further into the water. Water was near our chest.  We tried to swim out with the surfing board, but every time, the wave pull us further into the ocean.  The surfing board become a big drag, and frog swimming is also not powerful enough for us to swim out of wave. We don't know free style, which may be more useful. 

We began to wave our hands and yell for help, even though there aren't many people there. I began to think my life may end there, as the wave become bigger and bigger as we were dragged further into the ocean. 

Then, after a couple of more minutes, we saw the life guard from Anantara come to us with a larger surf board. We threw our small surfing boards, which was a major drag, and tried to climbed to theirs, but we have almost exhausted, and the wave has make it even harder.  I asked the life guard to save my wife first and wait for the second one to save me.  However, my wife can not climb to the rescuer's board, she just grabbed it, and that rescuer has also become exhausted himself because of this, and have to leave my wife, about tens of yards away from shore.  Quite a few hotel guests, jumped into the water, particularly Ben from Australia. They pulled my wife out of water and saved her life. 

So special thanks to Ben, though I only know he is Australian and came to Bali for vacation with her girlfriend. He has helped to calm down my wife, and ask her to throw up the sea water.  I was aslo rescured shortly after. 

Hotel manager of Anantara Seminyak Hotel, I recalled his name is Hilton, but not so sure, was immediately come and arranged Anantara car to bring us to an international hospital, to have thorough check.  The drivers have waited there for 30min to 1hr, until we checked in to the hospital, and was taken care of. 

My wife was hospitalized for 1 day, and when I go back to our hotel Anantara Vacation Club to pick up some of her cloth, all the staff have already know the accident and sent their best regards. The hotel manager, a handsome young man, also come to ask if there is any thing they need, and whether I need a car.  Don't exactly recall if I used one of their car, but it was very helpful and comforting. Eventually, we spend last day in the hotel, resting before leaving. It was an quite experience, and Anantara, both the villa, and hotel, have gave us very good impression. 

So very good hotel. You can depend on them.

Sorry for my English, not a native speaker. 

Ben, if you see this, want to think you again for saving my wife's life.
title: Staff are very helpful, and lifeguards saved life of my familiy

text:
Location: At least 30-45mins of travel time depending on traffic. It is within walking distant to shopping streets and close to some nice restaurants in Seminyak area too.

Front Office Staff: Staff is friendly and ensure that we feel at home. Not our first time there and thus, we are familiar with the property. Staff was able to identify we were returned guests and thus, a warm welcome.

2 bedroom pool villa: 6 of us stayed in a 2-bedroom pool villa. Cozy enough for the 6 of us. Staff set up a sleeping bed in the living area for 2 pax and helped to replace one king size bed for 2 single beds in one of the rooms. Would love to stay in the 3-bedroom villa but unfortunately, it was unavailable during my period of stay there.

Breakfast: Can only order one portion of food. Any extra orders will be chargeable. Selection of breakfast is very limited.

Restaurant: Only one small dining area. Does not bother us since we will be out most of the time.

Membership: We are platinum member and thus, services rendered were excellent and fantastic.

Overall: Will definitely stay here again. Hope that breakfast selections would be more and also, we could order extra portions.
title: Simple and nice property

text:
I had spent a holiday at Anantara Vacation Club resort Bali Seminyak. The resort is lovely. Commendation is credited especially to the staff at the resort. I had planned for diving trip before with a dive center (ASDB dive center). However due to communication failure, there was no pickup at all. While not denying my part n responsibilities in the communication failure, I could not go for my dive trip and in addition the dive center decided to push all the failure to me and treated my case as a "no show" and hence I had to forfeit my payment (full payment for a parties of 3 divers). In additional of claiming that there booking is full and could not offer me another date for diving.

However, the resort staff ( Miss Santi and Sri) was at hand to help me find another dive center n made another booking for diving the next day. As such I was able to fulfill my main objective for this Bali trip.

The resort staffs also are very helping and friendly in answering my questions and attending to our needs.

text: We stayed at the Anantara Vacation Club Bali Seminyak for a few nights, and that was a fantastic and memorable experience. To start, the resort features 20 individual villas only, which makes it very exclusive. We were lucky enough to be able to stay in the only 3-bedroom villa, which features 3 individual building (one with the living quarters on two floors), one with a living room and one with a kitchen and dining room) with a decent size open swimming pool in the middle. Very welcoming and attentive service from the front office and F&B staff in the resort. Housekeeping was doing a great job too. Really enjoyed that family vacation, and although the property in located in the middle of busy Seminiak, we really enjoyed a very quiet stay.
title: Amazing paradise in the middle of Paradise Island!

text: We ( my husband and a friend) just came back from our first trip to Bali and we enjoyed every minute of it. After the long travel,we were warmly welcomed by Sri and company and she showed us around - the reception area, the pool, the facilities and finally to our room located at the near end of the property. We occupied a one-bedroom villa and arrangement for a 3-person accommodation was in place.Upon entrance, we appreciated the soothing,relaxing Balinese ambiance around us.The dim-lit bedroom and well-lighted bathroom were spacious and clean. Anti-mosquito measures were provided for. All three of us agreed that  we had  blissful sleep and rest during our entire stay. The kitchen area though was small and there was no space to assemble the dripping rack.The coffee maker was not initially working and had to be replaced. Spoons were missing.No kitchen cloth/wipes or  floor rags around. As our schedule was tight, we had no opportunity to dine there. The Wi-Fi connection was spotty and not constant.The staff in the reception area was really helpful and accommodating.The location of the AVC is strategic and accessible  by foot to shops, restos- to savor a variety of gastronomic surprises,the beach and a supermarket, especially when one has to contend with the traffic. Overall,  we liked and enjoyed Anantara  Vacation Club- Seminyak, the hospitality was 2-thumbs up but it could do better with improvement and upgrading its facilities and amenities to match their other world-class resort clubs.
title: A quiet respite amidst the busy Seminyak

text:
We arrived earlier than the check-in time but luckily we were given room 114. The staff were friendly and the bellboy showed us around our villa. The villa pool size was bigger than imagined, with a bathtub that overseeing the pool outside. The bedroom size was okay to accommodate the 3 of us (we were travelling with our toddler) and the bathroom was quite huge. 

The bed was soft and comfy, and so was our toddler cot. We were happy that the baby cot was already setup upon our arrival. The Management could have also invested in mosquitoes net for baby cot as well since the mosquitoes rate was very alarming. And also suggesting to have bed decor, at least on the day of arrival. The curtains and mosquitoes net was dusty and did not appeared to look clean. The bedroom parquet flooring was squeaking. And on one of the nights (we stayed for a week), I think I heard rats running on the rooftop!

We also noticed that our villa was missing the umbrella and the straw bag. And the hair dryer was not working. For the missing umbrella and exchange of hair dryer, we have to request twice. No doubt the staff apologized but we are certain that a 5 star resort can do better. 

We were disappointed that our toddler was not given a towel, and were replenished 2 instead of 3 on our daily room make up. We did not like the quality and smell of the shampoo, body shower and lotion. Luckily we managed to get something we like at the nearby supermarket. 

The separate living room or kitchen was not convenient to us. Not to mentioned that there were lack of many items, i.e. kitchen cloth. The basin tap was tilted to the left, the water kettle did not look inviting and we dare not even touch the rusty coffee machine! The equipment and cabinets looked old. Anantara should consider to revamp the whole place when bought over from the previous owner. 

However we were grateful with the helpful staffs who prepared us with mosquitoes lamp as our little toddler was badly bitten by mosquitoes and gave us suggestions. Despite all the preventive measures (mosquitoes patch, repellent, oil, coil and lastly lamp), she got a total of 31 bites on her face and fingers (average of 5-6 bites every nights). And thanks to the GM, Jonathan, who visited us and provide explanations. 

We were quite upset with the daily set breakfast, which only consist of juice, yogurt, a choice of cereal or bread and coffee/tea. Would have been better if they come with a hot dish. The pizza also need improvement on taste and please take note if you order the seafood pizza. There was a fish bone in it and we were lucky that we were the one encountering it instead of our toddler!

The location of the club was good as only about 5-10 mins walk to the main busy street, with lots of café and convenient stores. One can easily hail a taxi but take note to insist on running a meter or a flat price.  Overall, it was different experience from Anantara Phuket Mai Khao. Hopefully our next Anantara trip would be better. 

We did had a great holiday despite the little inconveniences. And special thanks to the caring staffs from the reception and also the café. Tiffany and the rest, you did a great job!
title: Totally disappointed

text:
We arrived in Bali at about 0230 and were picked up from the airport and taken to our Villa. The driver was great and we used him again twice to take us on tours around Bali and we would have brought him home with us if we could have he was so fantastic. 
We were welcomed warmly to our villa and booked in very efficiently. 
We got to bed around 0430 and slept in the next morning. 
We went to lunch and this began the love affair with the food in Bali. 
We swam in the hotel pool after lunch and then went back to our villa and had another swim as each villa has their own pool. 
We went to dinner and had some beautiful food in our hotel dining room and  loved it. The service for the 15 days we were their was exemplary and the staff so friendly. 
Could not fault any person at the villas from the Gardner to the General Manager they were the most friendly people we have ever met anywhere in the world. 
The people of Bali were beautiful and so friendly we loved every minute of our holiday. I say to anyone who has reservations about going to Bali don't it is a wonderful beautiful country and the people are amazing. Best holiday ever.
title: Wedding Anniversary number 41

text:
I came here recently on a family trip as part of my introductory Anantara Vacation Club membership package. The service has been great, but I do not think I would come back nor extend my introductory package. 

The vacation club is tucked away in one of those alleyways not too far away from the main street, Seminyak St./Rd., which is about 15-20 minutes away on foot. However, that also means this property has no beach access, and really is not in the center of actions. They do run shuttle service to their beach front hotel every two hours or so.

Then there is the villa: my biggest problem was that the rooms were quite dated and not well maintained. They were spacious, yes, but definitely not new. Shower room door had faded paints, and there were other spots and signs of wear. It felt quite like a property from the 90s. 

The staff were very positive and polite and always smiling. They were by and large much more helpful than the Anantara Hotel staff I encountered (I stayed at the beach front hotel for the second leg of our stay). 

The default breakfast choice was pretty much nothing, maybe that's because few came for breakfast because of the fully equipped kitchen. All in all, it was continental break in its barest form (think continental breakfast on your university-organized trips), and I was dismayed.

Overall I just don't think it was good value, but I can see how it would work for people come with their families. This would not be my top pick, and is definitely enough to put me off from upgrading to a full membership.
title: Nothing to write home about

text:
We stayed here because my sister in law is a member of Anantara and she gifted a private villa to us for a few days.  long story short, it was a solid 3.5 star experience.  here are some tips to maximise your stay (in my humble opinion).

arrival:  don't get the Anantara taxi service.  it costs $30 USD (+21% tax), and most taxis will agree to around $12 (no tax), or 150,000 IDR.  we set one up prior to coming, but be committed to haggling at the exit.

service:  the service is here top notch. i contacted the GM via his responses to the reviews here on trip advisor and i mentioned to him that it was our 10 year anniversary.  he promptly replied and provided some amazing touches to the room that made me incredibly happy.  The GM, Jonathan, came through in big way.   the concierge also helped me a number of times, booking restaurants, recommending shopping places, giving us directions and so on.  

I must also say that the bell boy (or staffer) called Nangnang (sp?) gave us the best introduction and explanation to a suite i've ever experienced.  he showed everything and how it all worked.  he was really great.  so again, the service is 5 star here.

facilities:  so here's the thing, the Anantara villas is not a beach front property, that's Anantara Resort and Spa.  that property is very different, more on this later.  The vacation club villas provide you with your own private pool.  to be honest, we left our kids at home so we actually didn't use the pool.  we sunbathed and relaxed by our private pool one morning, but we wanted a beach and big pool experience, so we took the free shuttle to the Anantara Resort and Spa.

3 times a day, there's a free shuttle to the beachfront property.  you can take the free shuttle and then stay on their pool area, as long as you spend $25 per person on F&B.  we enjoyed a whole day there, suntanning, having poolside drinks and snacks, dipping into the pool, and taking full advantage of their free wifi.  i strongly advise taking a day to do that, as the infinity pool overlooking the beach is wonderful.  $25 isn't that bad, because it's $10 to rent any deck chair along the public beach.  but at Anantara you get wifi, sunscreen, towels, their nice bathroom, and their infinity pool.  

food:  since our stay did not include food we sadly did not eat there at all.  There are some great places to eat if you walk to the main strip on seminyak road (ask the concierge for the shortcut and a map) for breakfast.  for lunch and dinner, walk out to the main roads and you'll have great options for both local and international fare.  

obviously use trip advisor to find the spots you want, but don't be afraid to randomly try some places.  we took a chance on the #100 ranked restaurant in seminyak and we thoroughly enjoyed it.  adventure and have fun.

so, in summary, it's 5 star service, but with only 3 star facilities in my opinion.  it just wasn't as stunning as some other places, even when compared to their beach front property.  the things that dropped this rating to 3.5 stars for me was that the coffee machine in our villa was dirty and probably has never been cleaned properly.

i will say that many people complained about the mosquitos, but we did not have a problem.  they provide many ways to deal with them and i only got bit a few times during our 4 day trip, but it was not at the property.  so just use the sprays provided and be mindful of closing doors.

bottom line, i enjoyed our stay at the Anantara vacation club Bali, especially enjoying their service, but i left thinking that I would like to stay at the Anantara resort and spa.  Also, if choosing between this property and the Phuket one, I would suggest the Phuket one based on facilities and access to the turtle village.

hope this helps!
title: Great service, facilities not the best.

text:
Stayed 2 nights in one-bedroom private pool villa, room no. 114 as a promotion offer by credit card. Before we came here, we were a bit thrilled by the negative reviews on Tripadvisor saying the room is old and kinda dirty, as well as the problem with mosquito. But after our stay here, I would definitely want to write a review to share our own amazing experience in here!

The entire villa is with high privacy. Inside the villa it's big enough (About 100 sq.m), with living room that equipped with cooking facilities, utensils and television, pool (but quite small in size), bedroom and bathroom. The decoration of the bedroom looks retro yet romantic with the wooden floor and furniture. Bathroom was bright and clean, and the bathtub is really big. They also have a bit outdoor area outside where you can hang and dry your clothes after washing. 

Let's talk about the mosquito problem people are worrying about - they provided spray and lotion to avoid getting bites. We everytime after shutting the door of the bedroom, we will apply spray and lotion on our skin. Inside the room there was also electric mosquito repellent to help. To be frank under the cool air temperature with air con, mosquito would not be very active, and not to mention after all these prevention, we did not get bites inside the room. But if you are talking about at outdoor area inside the villa, personally think it's inevitable given that you are visiting Bali, a tropical area. Yet, we did not really see mosquito or other insects inside the villa and the resort, I thought I saw the staff doing pest control everyday.

We spent most of our time chilling inside the villa, except going out for dinner. There's a supermarket around (COCO SUPERMARKET) at about 10-min walk. We bought some fresh food and cooked our own lunch in the living room. I love to cook a lot and was surprised for all the utensils and appliances they provided - like rice cooker, toast machine etc. You could clean all utensils with detergent and new cleaning scrub pad. All appliance functioned well and utensils were quite new (despite some dishes get marks).

For dining experience, we only had breakfast at the cafe. The breakfast composited of a fruit juice, beverage (coffee or tea), yoghurt, main (Rice/Noodles/Pastry or Egg dish) and some muesli/fruit aside. The food were well prepared and were full. Will be great if the menu can be in more variation.

For facilities, they have a bigger swimming pool outside and fitness centre. We did not went to the pool, and for fitness centre it is equipped with basic equipment like fit ball, yoga mats, dumbbell, 1 treadmill, 1 elliptical and 1 cycling machine. Given the capacity of the villa itself think the numbering and variety of the facilities can be improved.

Let's talk about the Staff - Tifani, the staff at help desk was cheerful and efficient when check-in. She then lead us to the room and introduced well, with a little bit humour. She also helped us check-out and called for a taxi when we were leaving to Ubud. Manager was very sincere and greeted us when we left the resort.

Staff in cafe area were polite and responsive, despite I spot that when it was at peak hour, there were only 2 staff at the cafe doing all serving tasks. Some mainland china travellers were  not patient for not being served and ordered their breakfast right after they were seated. May need to arrange 1 more staff when cafe is at peak. Overall staff were friendly who always greet you when seeing you inside the resort. 

Visitor could enjoy the beach and pool facility at Anantara Resort & Spa Seminyak, they provided some shuttle service but you need to spend USD$25/ head for dining at there. The amount is acceptable and could be considered if you are looking for sunshine and beach. But we did not go for it since we already had enough during our stay in Nusa Dua prior to visiting Seminyak.

It was truly a great, relaxing and soothing experience for our stay, and we will consider Anantara chain for our upcoming trips in other places!
title: A true amazing experience in Anantara!

owner_response.text:
Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to share on Tripadvisor your feedback regarding your recent stay at Anantara Vacation Club Bali Seminyak. 

It is only through feedback such as this that we are able to continually review the facilities and services we provide to ensure that they meet our guests' expectations at all times. 

It was pleasing to read that you enjoyed the high level of comfort offered in all our large pool villas. I was also happy to learn that you enjoyed the breakfast and food in the restaurant. 

I will be looking in to the issues you raised regarding the air con and cleanliness as a matter of urgency. This is generally not the case. 

Regarding your comment re the rats, we have never seen rats at the resorts. Some guests have reported that after leaving their living room doors open, cats have come in and eaten any food that they have left out. Perhaps this was what happened in your villa also?

We would love to have you come and stay with us again. Please feel free to contact me directly at jsweeneylowe@anantaraclub.com should I be able to assist you in any way in the future.

Jonathan

text:
the hotel premises is very private with only 17 villas in total. there is one restaurant and we pretty much cleared everything off the menu from the time we had arrived. bali was having the nyepi weekend which meant we had to stay in the hotel premises all day saturday, disappointing because AVC did not inform us in advance that this was a major holiday.

the hotel is also not near the beach & instead you will be battling mosquitos throughout your stay, though adequate sprays are provided to you. 

compared to other AVC properties we've stayed at, the property does not represent the anantara hotels we are used to staying at and given that bali has so many great properties, we'd probably try something else next time around.

on the upside, the hotel was super private which meant the staff knew each and every one of us, and catered to us 110%. the service was outstanding!!

definitely recommend it if you are looking to switch off completely, and being pampered while staying in your villa 100% of the time.
title: fantastic service, but lacked everything else..

owner_response.text:
Hi there,

I was delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and so pleased that you took time to share this with Tripadvisor’s readers. 

It was pleasing to read that you enjoyed the genuine hospitality and good service from a team that I am so lucky to have. 

My sincere apologies for the inconvenience of the Nyepi holiday. We did send out emails in advance to all guests that were staying with us over the holiday. It is therefore strange that you did not receive prior notice. I apologise again for any inconvenience caused.

With regards to the mosquitos, we do everything possible to limit guest exposure to these native creatures; regular spraying, fogging etc. It is impossible to get them all but I am glad that you felt adequate preventative measures were provided.

The concept for the property in Bali is very different to the one in Phuket and Samui. We have gone with a more boutique style that offers a very high level of personalised service, which I believe you did enjoy. It is true that some owners prefer the bigger style hotels of Phuket & Samui. However, there are equally as many who enjoy the Bali offering in AVC's attempt to offer our owners variety in their vacation choices. 

We would love to have you come and stay with us again. Please feel free to contact me directly at jsweeneylowe@anantaraclub.com should I be able to assist you in any way in the future.

Kind regards,
Jonathan

text: The staff were amazingly friendly, courteous, efficient, helpful and tolerant of my attempts to communicate in Balinese/Indonesian.  The villas were spacious, clean, and private. The food at the onsite restraunt was always very good. The resort was 20 min from the beach, walking, but even closer to clubs, restraunts, and shops.  While the resort was amazing, walking anywhere you had to watch your step along what little sidewalk area that was available as there were open spaces with the drainage system below.  There was a shuttle which left 3 times a day to the  beach.  When you exchange your money for rupiah make certain that the money changer is part of a larger institution as one had a sign that the exchange rates can fluctuate without notice.  Which they did as soon as we had signed the form which had a blank space for the exchange rate!  The moneychangers closer to the beach offer poorer exchange rates than those a few blocks inland.  The traffic is insane and I recommend utilizing the taxis for any major traveling.  Taxi rates can be variable, negotiate before you get in the taxi and keep in mind that there are quite a few drivers that for $40 - $50 USD will spend the entire day taking you wherever you want.  Bali was fascinating and I will definitely return someday.
title: Our most memorable vacation yet

text:
Just completed my 3-night stay over the weekend. 5-stars for services, 2-stars for villa condition. The condition of the first villa assigned to us was less than ideal. The customer service team responded to my feedback quickly and moved us to another villa of better condition.  

As mentioned in many of the posts before, the condition of the villas is rather rundown and much less than the usual Anantara standard. The mosquito problem here is significant, and will be even more so if you are here like me with a young kid. It is near impossible to enjoy the lovely yard unless you stay in the pool or doused yourself with insect repellent. Mosquito activity peaks at dusk. So much so that you get a constant buzzing around your ears if you stay outdoors and you will get a fair bit sneaking into the room as well. Have to keep my baby son under the mosquito net upon night fall.

While the state of the villas is not in non-liveable condition, it is definitely rundown and not worthy if Anantara wants to brand itself as "Asia's leading _luxury_ shared ownership concept". 

My wife very impressed when she stayed here 3 years back when it was still "Ranadi Villas". She was full of expectations when we found out that Anantara took over. You can only imagine her disappointment.

Nonetheless, kudos to the warm and wonderful service given by Jonathan and team. I have nothing but praises for them. The stay will be perfect if I get Jonathan's team in a location that is true to Anantara standard. Good job, team Jonathan!
title: 5-star customer service but 2-stars villa condition.

owner_response.text:
Dear Paulina,

Thank you for taking the time to share on Tripadvisor your feedback regarding your recent stay at Anantara Vacation Club Bali Seminyak. 

It is only through feedback such as this that we are able to continually review the facilities and services we provide to ensure that they meet our guests' expectations at all times. 

I was pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed the facilities offered by our pool villas. They are certainly ideal for families and I am happy that your children enjoyed their time at the resort! 

I was also delighted to learn that you enjoyed the food at the restaurant. We are blessed with fantastic chefs who have designed a menu that appeals to all palettes...especially the pizzas! It is a shame that the kids did not have a go at our pizza making activity...fun to be had on your next visit.

Regarding the washing machines, we are currently looking in to providing some extra units. With only 18 Villas, it is very rare that guests find the machines unavailable. There must have been a particularly high demand for them during your visit. My apologies for any inconvenience caused.

While I understand that you would have perhaps preferred to be closer to the beach, we do offer a shuttle service and it only takes a few minutes before you are relaxing on the beach with a drink in your hand.

With regards to mosquitos, we make every effort to limit guest exposure to this natural island presence; regular fogging, spraying, as well as providing repellent and coils in all villas. It is true that some are more sensitive to them than others. I apologise if their presence in any way disturbed you and your family. 

Thank you for once again for your comments. Please feel free to contact me directly should I be able to offer any further assistance.

Kind Regards

With regards to the pools, while the villa pools are not as large as our main pool, most of our owners find them adequate for a refreshing dip and even for doing a few lengths in the morning.

And in terms of location, while I understand that you would have perhaps preferred to be closer to the beach, as you pointed out, we do provide a shuttle service that only takes a few minutes before you are relaxing on the beach with a cocktail in your hand!

I was however pleased to hear that the service and staff at the resort met with your expectations. We are very lucky to have such a good team and are constantly reviewing our services and facilities to ensure we are providing our guests with the very best.

text: We stayed at a few Anantara resorts in Thailand and Maldives and just have to say this one in Seminyak is a bit disappointing. Service is still great as usual but the pool is quite small and the lights in the room are way too dim. The villa seems smaller I guess because the room and kitchen are separated. What disappointed us the most is the size of the property and how there is only one restaurant. title: Not as great compared with other vacation club properties

owner_response.text:
Dear Stella,

Thank you for taking the time to share on Tripadvisor your feedback regarding your recent stay at Anantara Vacation Club Bali Seminyak. 

It is only through feedback such as this that we are able to continually review the facilities and services we provide to ensure that they meet our guests' expectations at all times. 

I was disappointed to read that you were not entirely satisfied with our facilities here at Anantara Vacation Club and I would like o apologise for any inconvenience caused. 

I was however pleased to hear that the service at the resort met with your expectations.

It is true that in our efforts to offer our owners variety in their holiday vacation options, the concept here in Bali is much more of a boutique hotel and it is exactly because of its size that we are able to offer the personalised, intimate service that you mentioned and so many of our owners enjoy. 

While I understand that you would have perhaps preferred to be closer to the Anantara hotel, we have a number of spas and restaurants within walking distance from the AVC resort which I hope you got the chance to sample.

Jonathan Sweeney-Lowe

text:
the property is small but the pool villa is fantastic. the room size is great for a couple, with a separate tv & reading area with kitchen facilities and of course the pool with its deck chair. there is a soaking tub with bath salts provided and separate toilet and shower facilities. the bed is very comfortable and we slept well.
the staff are very polite and friendly and the receptionist are professional and knowledgeable. whenever we need anything, the staff will usually respond within 5 minutes, appearing at our door steps promptly.
our pool villa lights were not working, our coffee machine faulty and there were no gas at the stove. however, the staff responded so promptly and so courteously that all was forgotten and we went on to have a great stay in the villa.
if you are adventurous, take a walk or cab to Coco mart. it is a well stocked supermarket with fresh produce, fruits, canned food, pasta, cooking needs and snacks. they even sell sunscreen lotions, aromatherapy oils, diapers, slippers and clothings.
the food joints around AVC Bali are amazing, from Greek to Mexican to Italian, Bali food, warung etc. we had wagyu beef steak, tenderloin steak and suckling pig, all for good price. try Rumours and Nirvana :)
if you wish to change currency, head for the authorised money changer eg. PT Azzahra Maulana. the rate may not be as good but you are guaranteed your money's worth. some money changers at souvenir shop fronts offer good rates but take you to the back lane to exchange currency. you are at their mercy then and likely you might be cheated.
By the way, at the airport, go to the Airport Taxi counter. tell them where you are headed and they will let you know how much it cost and give you a booking slip. To head back to the airport, ask the hotel to call for Blue Bird cab. it only costs us 70,000 rupiah to airport.
title: restful stay

text: I had booked one 2 bedroom villa and 1 single bedroom villa for my group. The welcome at the resort was warm and our rooms were ready. The walk to the rooms does feel a bit strange as they are in one straight line and as a result it does not feel like a resort. The 2 bedroom villa is really spacious...The rooms are well furnished...the bathrooms are fancy and the middle living area and kitchen looks inviting. We used the private pool on both days and well its was good but I was always unsure about the cleanliness of the water since its open air. One of the drawbacks of the property is that the lighting in all the rooms is poor so it does become kinda depressing towards the evening. The resort is close to the Seminyak market but quite far from the beach and you have to cab it to any of the happening spots. I had to sit through a presentation with my wife on the 2nd day and go through the sales pitch of the Vacation Club staff. I did find them a bit insistent even after I had indicated that it would not suit my holiday style. I would rate the staff and service as friendly. Breakfast was ok and you had to choose from a set menu. There are a couple of cheap and good massages just outside the hotel which you should try. So the rating on the property is that it will suit you if you are traveling with a large group and if you like vacations clubs...I would prefer the full service beach resorts in Nusa Dua if you are in Bali.
title: A Vacation Club Experience

text:
Our stay at Anantara Vacation Club Bali Seminyak was average and not up to expectation, considering that it is one of the Anantara properties. 

We stayed at the pool villa for 3 nights and the villa itself is quite beautiful. If you are looking for privacy and a quiet environment, it would be a suitable place. However, the vacation club is situated in town surrounded by walls which does not give a holiday feeling. There are also very few facilities and the main pool is not so attractive.

The vacation club is also a bit far from the beach and its so called "beach club" is ridiculous. It is just a few umbrellas and beach chairs at a deserted stretch along the coastline. We had to use a dirty bathroom of the restaurant nearby. Luckily, we were able to use the facilities of its sister hotel Anantara Seminyak Resort & Spa with a minimum spending on food & beverage. Its main pool and beach bar are very decent. The service there is a lot better than the vacation club. We could see more staff with smiley faces. 

The quality of food at the vacation club's restaurant and in-room dining was average (but the Bali flavour pizza was excellent). We would not recommend its Babi Kuling which was disappointing (there is a reputable Babi Kuling place nearby but we did not have a chance to try). For dining options adjacent to the vacation club, you could go to the main street (around 5 minutes by taxi) with a lot of restaurants. Otherwise, the restaurants at Anantara Seminyak Resort & Spa are also nice. 

The WIFI at the vacation club was annoying. We had to key in the specific login name and password on its login page every time when we wanted to use the WIFI.
title: Average, not up to expectation

You will be pleased to learn that we have since closed the beach club that you mentioned and now offer a shuttle 3 times daily to the Anantara Seminyak, where owners may enjoy the beach lawn and pool facilities you highlighted for a minimum spend on food and beverage of roughly USD 25 per person.

text:
This is a little gem tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the main drag in Seminyak but within walking distance of all the great restaurants, massages and tattoo parlours that seem to have proliferated in this part of Bali!! The Villas are ideal for a couple or small family, and the Avani has all the amenities you need (great gym, but no spa sadly). But the best thing about this place is the staff, who were outstanding, very thoughtful and went out of their way to make us feel at home. We stay in Anantaras and Avanis a lot....and I can safely say that the staff here are the best we have encountered in Asia. Dewa and Prida were amazing - looking after us even when my wife got sick! 

Thanks for a lovely stay guys.
title: A great little gem in Seminyak

text:
This has to be the best boutique villa resort we have ever stayed..ever! 

The location of the resort is pretty near to the Seminyak beach which is only about 10mins away. However, it is very near to the Seminyak shopping and dining venues like Seminyak Square or the Flea Market areas. Location is also very peaceful and quiet within a villa neighbourhood and it gets you away from the bustling nightlife area after a day of shopping and play which was fantastic for us! There is even a golfcart service provided to bring us to the nearby Anantara properties for spa and dining options as well where guests are provided further discounts!

The quiet and cosy resort is very well maintained with beautiful landscape areas nicely manicured by the hardworking gardeners everyday while we stayed there. Check-in process was a breeze with the concierge helping with the luggage once we arrived at the reception. Our 1 bedroom pool villa was fantastic and beautifully decorated with the local flavours of Bali. The private villa pool is a welcoming sight for us as well and we had the 2nd option of the main pool at the side of the restaurant. The deck chairs beside the villa pool allows guests to relax and unwind in private which is great. There is also a small kids club play area and a library room within the main reception building together with the main sitting area which was beautifully renovated during the pandemic.

Our bedroom in the villa was huge for the 2 of us and the bathroom was also nicely laid out. There is even a bottle of bath salt that was refilled daily for your bath tub soak to relax the day away. Another shower head at the outdoor area of the toilet will be nice too. A tote bag and sarong are available in the wardobe for us to use when we go to places of attractions which was very thoughtful. LED TV in the room is also large with clear reception of international satellite channels. However the LED TV at the living room did not have clear reception and thus we only watched the programmes in the bedroom.  Kitchenette is also fully equipped and great for small snacks. The only issue we had was that the wall of the bedroom seems to be thin and may need further sound insulation as we can hear the conversations of other guests passing by from within our room.

Breakfast was served daily at the restaurant via ala carte style with nice pool view and I must say the spread was fantastic! We were greeted warmly daily by the F&B teams by name and they really did a commendable job! Especially the young trainee Mr Yoga who really treated us like close friends and not just guests. We tried the local dishes for dinner too and we were not disappointed. Afternoon tea with their mocktails was also something that we are very happy with.

We would like to sincerely thank Pak Made Subrata, the GM whom gave us such warm hospitality during our stay and Pak Ardi and his team who took very good care of us from the day we arrived. Other than recommendations of nearby attractions, he even offered to send us around the vicinity when he is available so that we can get there safely and comfortably. Truely commendable and top notch service from the entire team at Avani Seminyak! We are truely missing Bali and Avani again!
title: Best Boutique Villa Resort ever!

text:
Stayed for 10 nights with my wife. I don't know why many said 10 nights were too long but just nice for us. Based on the other reviews, similar experience for us, hospitality is always good in most places in Bali, they always greet guests. First 9 nights was staying in the apartment but was upgraded to pool villa on our last night, thanks to the push from AVC. Will definitely opt for the pool villa next time we are back. To us this resort is better than AVC Legian, more Balinese style and quieter.

Breakfast was unfortunately limited in choices but nothing wrong with the taste. If you are staying long like us you might be bored with it, but me and my wife are ok. Entering the narrow driveway gives you a sense of exploration. Location to us was not too bad as we rented scooter and a car. You can definitely walk out to search for food and drinks.

My wife noticed an Australian lady commenting about the music played during breakfast. She suggested to play Balinese songs rather and pop songs for a more relaxing breakfast. The next day the restaurant did changed it, good to know they do take guest comments into action.

Just one thing that keeps bugging me, for the entire 10 days of breakfast we had, we were asked for our room number each day, even by the similar waiters/waitresses. Not much as issue actually but would be good if you do make an effort to remember your guests' room number or even their names. Don't think peak or not peak season has any effect on the effort.
title: Bali Trip Dec 2022

text:
We are finishing up our stay at Avani and I just want to say it’s been beyond wonderful.

It’s our first time to Bali and we wanted to be near the shops but also the beach. We also had to take our 18 month old into consideration. We booked a two bedroom apartment and upon arrival at Avani we were upgraded to an apartment with plunge pool!

The apartment is massive, so airy and peaceful. We have our own kitchen as well which has been wonderful for cleaning baby bottles etc. The bathrooms are pristine and the beds are super comfy. Having a baby you need reliable wifi (for the white noise) and black out blinds (which ee brought with and didn’t need to use!) the rooms have excellent curtains which block out the light so you get a great nights sleep.

The plunge pool is brilliant to cool off on a hot day and just chill around, especially while baby naps. I’m equally impressed by the locks on the door going out to the pool. I am so fearful about that kind of thing, especially around a toddler who cannot swim. 

There are washing machines and dryers they are in great condition and FREE to use. This means we don’t have to do all that annoying post holiday washing back at home! 

There is a bigger pool on site which is brilliant as well as a restaurant. You can have your breakfast in the restaurant or you can have it in the apartment. We love to have it in the apartment as it means our toddler can eat and run around. We don’t have to worry about her becoming annoyed in the high chair for too long. The breakfast you order off a menu. It’s delicious, filling and presented so beautifully. 

There is a shuttle bus that does drop offs and pickups to the beach three times a day. Very very handy. When we haven’t wanted to walk, we have just caught a taxi/blue bird for $3 to basically any street of shopping/restaurants in Seminyak. Super easy! 

The biggest stand out for us has been the staff. We have stayed at many five star resorts across Asia and we have never been somewhere where EVERY single member of staff you meet is just so kind and willing to assist you. From Frieda at the front desk to Nyoman  doubt I have spelt it right, apologies!) who was working on the pristine gardens everyone is just so kind. It was my birthday here and they saw the birthdate on my passport and organised a cake for me! Front desk has also given us a late check out because we have a baby with us and they acknowledged she will need a nap and asked us if the late checkout would work for us.

If you’re staying in Seminyak for the first time or you have a child, I would definitely recommend the Avani! 

Thank you to all the staff who work so hard to make it so wonderful.
title: Loved it! Cannot recommend highly enough!

text:
We managed to book a one-bedroom apartment suite and given that we are GHA Titanium members, we managed to score an upgrade to the one-bedroom villa. It was clearly the best hotel that we have stayed in Bali thus far. The rooms were well-appointed, and many amenities available. It has a fully functional kitchen which is quite crazy. The only problem we had was the bathtub which is constantly leaking off water, we took almost an hour to setup the bubble bath. 

We also tried the dinner and breakfast at Groove and the food quality is incredible, very reasonable prices. Our stay comes with a bunch of dining coupons so it is actually cheaper than outside, they also allow in-room dining so makes all the more to just stay in. 

The Villa comes with a 4 metre lap pool that you can get some chill time, we basically spent our last day in the villa and had a lazy day. It was so good. The service here is great too, they had beach shuttle service to the Seminyak beaches, laundry etc etc. 

It is a 5-star stay but yet very wallet friendly, we will come back again for sure.
title: If you are a GHA member, this is super-underrated property.

text:
If, like us, you enjoy exploring the area on foot, the location is really fine, as it’s surrounded by countless laneways and alleys. We took the free shuttle to the beach one day, but decided to walk back to do more exploring.
Our one bedroom pool villa was very comfortably furnished, with effective air conditioning and ceiling fans in both rooms. There were bathrobes and slippers plus lots of extras including insect repellant, hand sanitizers and large bottles of drinking water. There were three showers and two toilets. The bathroom included a lovely, free-standing bath tub and large, eco-friendly toiletry dispensers. The kitchen was well equipped, although we didn’t use it, as there were loads of great local restaurants nearby.
All members of staff we met, from front of house and security to gardeners, housekeeping and waitstaff in the restaurant, were exemplary, being friendly, efficient and helpful. Pre-stay emails were answered promptly, all my questions were answered  and requests granted. As a Titanium Discovery member, I received a double accommodation upgrade, a fruit platter and a late checkout. 
The a la carte breakfast was very good; nicely prepared and well presented, with quite a few choices. All of this considered, it’s terrific value for money!
title: Great Value for Money.

text:
We stayed for 4 nights in a one bedroom apartment. It was like new and very spacious, with modern amenities. 
It was down a lane so very quiet with no street noise. It was very easy to call the hotel buggy if we didn’t feel like walking the path to breakfast.
Meals are served in the open restaurant looking over the pool and the food was delicious. Breakfast was ample and served at the table. 
The hotel was very clean and hygienic, with staff masked all the time and hand sanitiser in our apartment.
It was very quiet at the pool so we had no trouble getting one of the 4 cabanas. It was a pity that one of the villa guests took the pool’s inflatable flamingo and didn’t return it as I heard children asking for it.
There are washing machines and dryers for those needing to was their clothes.
It’s a great little place with lovely staff, and I would happily return
title: Peaceful retreat in Seminyak

text:
Stayed one night and as GHA Platinum I was upgraded to the one bed room villa with private swimming pool. It is very SPACIOUS. On the right there is a big bed room with king size bed, table to work, wardrobe and enough space to wonder around. The bathroom has a big window with the bathtub next to it, then separate toilet, separate indoor shower with rainshower head and normal one, PLUSSS another outdoor shower area. Privacy is quaranteed.

On the other side of  the villa is the kitchen area, fully equipped so that you can do your own meal if you'd like, although ordering from their kitchen will not disappoint. There is a sofa and table there, along with TV. 

Then there is the swimming pool and another outdoor sitting area where breakfast were served and 2 lounge chair to sun tan if interested.  

In the property there is also a washing machine and dryer that can be used by the guests for free. Ideal for longer stay.

Despite being in close by to Seminyak main road, it is very quiet! Service was excellent and the whole villa was clean.
title: Hidden gem in the middle of Seminyak
