text: Had an excellent stay at the Avani vila resorts. We stayed in the 2 bedroom villa with pool. It was definitely too big for two people, but it was great to have all the extra space and extra bathroom! A big shout out to Frida who helped us secure an amazing last minute price. She was lovely and always made time to chat to see how we were doing. In fact, everyone at Avani was super friendly and was always on hand to help. The villa itself was great - we loved the massive pool that connected to the living room. You could just open the living door and step into the pool! The beds were big and comfy, the bathrooms were nice and big (although the toilet do need replacing, mine was a bit wobbly). The kitchenette area was functional, but a bit tired and probably needs updating. And if you ever have time to watch TV, I'd say the TVs were a bit old and the sound came out tinny and hard to hear unless you turned it up really loud. The location was great - about 7 min walk from all the restaurants and shops. There's a mall about a 20 minute walk away and same for the beach. I'd recommend a scooter/car to get around tho, unless you only want to stay in the Seminyak area. They have parking at the resort, so no need to worry about that. Overall, we had a great time and would definitely stay again!
title: Seminyak stay

text:
Our stay was nothing more than amazing! 
Despite staying over the long weekend during Hari Raya, there was no lapse in the service from the resort. 

1. Early Check in 
Called the hotel at 1130am to check if an early check in at 1pm is possible, staff mentioned that my room was ready for check-in in the next 1 hour. How amazing. 

2. Room upgrade 
Booked a 2 BR suite and was upgraded to suite with a plunge pool. The staff brought us to our room and even showed us around. They also provide washer and dryer for free! Even the detergent was provided. 

3. Room
Room was huge, clean, well equipped with a full kitchen and very well maintained. If you do drink ALOT of water, the resort provided an option to have a water dispenser in your room at a small fee, alternatively they  provide bottled water. All rooms, living area and pool area had ceiling fans too. Wifi was fast, took a video conference call and there was no bandwidth issue. Housekeeping staff were also very helpful and friendly! Although we were staying at the far end, there are buggy services available. 

4. F&B/Staff 
Food were reasonably priced for a luxury resort. I had a chance to order room service and dine in at the restaurant for breakfast. Ordered a breakfast set to takeaway as my friend woke up late, they staff offered to deliver the breakfast to the room. They even recognized me the next day and asked if I wanted to order breakfast for my friend whom is still not awake yet. Lastly the guards, FO staff, F&B, housekeeping staff were nothing short of amazing! Kudos to the whole team keeping their smiles on despite having a full house over the long weekend. 

Lastly, checkout was a breeze. We had informed the staff of our checkout time in advance. 5 Mins after we checked out, one of the staff told us they found a charger in our room. Wasn't expecting them to had checked the room for us all within 5 mins.

Thank you for the amazing hospitality!
title: Amazing Stay and Staff!

text:
Check-in was ok.

As Platinum members we received a "double upgrade" to a "one bedroom villa". Room was nicely decorated. Pool was polluted as filter systems appears to be insufficient.

As we have paid more than 150 USD net, this was to be expected and their room levels appear to be very artificial.

During breakfast we were told that an omelette together with a very simple nasi goreng as well as even a 2nd would coffee would be chargeable.  No service attention and attitude during the breakfast.

After we left the breakfast with this experience, we were called on our room that we can have a 2nd coffee without charge.
Incredible and ridiculous.

When we wanted to check out, we were told that the room needs to be checked first before we can check out making us feeling like criminals.
The reception did bot recognize when we wanted to check out even we called before from the room.

Incredible service experience for this price.

Don't spend more than 60-max70 USD++ and only if you have low expectations. We are surprised that GHA Discovery is not auditing this place.

We would rather choose any other 4* or even 5* property for this price

text:
The hotel is located in the heart of Seminyak, so it's very easy to get around the bustling district of Seminyak. The only problem is parking, as the space is limited. So those of you who personally drive your car should be mindful.

We stayed in the 2BR Apartment with plunge pool and the amenities are very complete. They have all the necessities for a full-functioning apartment. Right across our room is a laundromat which is free to use for in-house guest. The hotel even provided the detergent for that.

In terms of experience, we can say that 95% of the interaction with the hotel service is of the highest standard, hence nothing to complain about. The restaurant was especially helpful, replacing unsatisfactory order with a new much better food.

In retrospect, there is no reason for us not to stay there again. But next time we'll try to do it in the 2BR Villa. Hopefully the hotel will save one for us.
title: Great location, great amenities, satisfactory experience

text:
It was my first time to Indonesia and this hotel exceeded my expectations. We got the standard room and was like an apartment style with a balcony area and kitchenette and living room. We were fortunate to have really hot sunny days in the low rainy season, so having a day bed by the pool area everyday was fantastic. 
There was also a free laundry area with amenities included which was handy

Groove Restaurant food was fantastic catering for all cuisines times with happy hours drinks. The staff at the hotel was absolutely beautiful, friendly and accommodating, which made our stay even more magical. The location was very convenient with only  5- 10 minutes walk to the main shopping, restaurant area and had a free shuttle to the sister hotel located on the beach with more option for food and drinks. 
We found it surprisingly quiet as we were located in a popular area making it busy but couldn't hear any traffic or noise, even at the general pool area.  Would definitely recommend and come back for a  longer visit.
title: Magical

text: I stayed here with my parents only for a week but it was memorable. The hotel itself is beautiful and very clean. Service was above expectations because they were so accommodating to all our needs. My mother got hurt and they offered the buggie to drive her to our room and our flight was delayed they let us wait in the air conned waiting room. They offered us masks to prevent coronavirus. The food at the resort is delicious and highly recommend the grilled fish rice dish which we ordered repeatedly. The staff were very friendly when we walk past they all say hello and welcome which made it feel like a family. We would definitely come back again because of this great service. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about going to Bali! Thanks for making it such a great experience!

text:
We had the most perfect time at Avani Seminyak. All of the staff (including the concierge staff) were so warm and friendly at all times we were there. The concierge staff in particular were extremely friendly, always greeted us by name and were very happy to go the extra mile for us. For example, they were always happy to help us speak to the Grab drivers whenever the Grab drivers got lost and could not find the resort. On separate occasions we also left an umbrella at Merah Putih restaurant and a watch at Cafe Del Mar beach club, and the staff went the extra mile to contact those places to help us to retrieve our belongings. Overall, the service was faultless from every single staff we encountered in the resort.

The villa, while not the newest, was kept very neat and clean and always well-stocked with amenities. We could not find any fault with the villa facilities. The resort is also quite conveniently located and we were happy to walk out to the main Seminyak walking area from the resort. It is also a short Grab or taxi ride away to the best Seminyak restaurants and beach clubs like Potato Head and Mrs Sippy. 

Overall, we had a perfect experience at Avani Seminyak and unreservedly recommend it to anyone who is thinking of staying in Seminyak. We would come back to stay here on our next visit without question.
title: Couples Trip March 2020

text:
Very impressed with our recent visit to Avani. We traded through Interval and this has probably been our best trade yet. The staff made us feel like family. The unit was spacious and clean and the location was perfect for waking to the main strip or the beach. 

The pool was deep and larger than expected. Also loved that the unit had a second washroom. They supplied all the amenities including bug spray and a mosquito coil which they light every night. We didn’t get any big bites there. 

Also very impressed with the on site restaurant. The food was delicious and on par in terms of price with other restaurants in the area so we were happy to order from them regularly. If you do decide to venture offsite we really enjoyed Hibiscus restaurant which is a few doors down. 

There is a Circle K next door where you can buy drinks and snacks. We also changed our money there a few times and were never shorted. 

Overall would highly recommend. I wish we were closer so we could come back again.
title: Great home base

text: Perfect hotel for staying in Seminyak Bali. Such a quiet hotel, an escape from the day clubs and busy streets, just what you need to come home to. Would recommend staying here, location fantastic nearby to restaurants and bars. A short taxi ride away from all the day clubs of Seminyak, Canggu, Jimbarran, Kuta, and the airport. Transfers were included and very useful as wouldn't like to arrange my own pickup at Bali airport. The food was great, good for quiet drinks before heading out. All the staff so happy and could not do more for you. We booked an extra night as night flights back to Sydney, and the hotel was perfect for the last day relaxing by the pool, the only couple at the pool all day! We had a hotel room, but there were lots of private villas with their own pools where we thought most people may have been, or at the many day clubs. We are British living down under, and the day clubs definitely had an Ibiza feel about them!

text:
My partner and I just stayed at Avani for 7 days. We booked through luxury escapes and we were not disappointed! 
Our package included breakfast everyday and lunch OR dinner daily. The food you do get included is good quality and a generous size. You can even ask to have the food delivered to your room if you want. 

The staff were all so beautiful. Smiling and welcoming and happy to help with whatever we needed. We were genuinely sad to leave. 

The rooms are comfortable and have facilities available for cooking etc. but we didn’t use them as we ate at the villa restaurant but the fridge comes in handy for water and drinks if you want to buy your own. 

The location is great - close enough to the Main Street or the beach if you want to walk or cheap enough to get a taxi (about 7-10 thousand rupiah). There is also a convenience store about a 2 minute walk and a money exchange which we used and had no issues with. 

Overall we loved our stay and we will definitely be back!
title: Beautiful stay!

text:
Our 2 week family holiday was spent here and we cant wait to go back.

The Villas with private pool were great quality, very clean and inviting which made my first visit to Bali very comfortable.
The staff were exceptional. Very friendly and helpful with everything. The also gave advice and tips to help a first time visitor to Bali get the best value and not get ripped off. The Serai restaurant had beautiful food where we often ate and the room service we realised had no extra charge.
There are many complimentary benefits such as all toiletries (inc. soap, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, toothbrush & paste, vanity kits, shower caps, sanitary bags, insect repellant, sunscreen) were restocked daily; fresh linen daily, birthday cake for my sons birthday, activities and lessons, laundry appliances and detergent, wake up calls, mosquito management staff, baggage storage for late checkout and much more.
Beautiful and inviting from the moment you go down the drive way. The pictures are what you get.
Very accommodating staff that placed more family that arrived days later very close by.
I was not disappointed one bit.
title: Cant wait to go back

text:
Thanks to an interval getaway, we were lucky to find this hidden paradise. We upgraded to a 2 bedroom villa , which has maximum capacity of 8 guests and we were glad we did. Very spacious, well equipped and the staff were not just smiling and courteous, they went out of their way to meet our every need. 

We did order room service and it was quickly brought and very delicious. Since we had a fully equipped kitchen, we cooked alot and ate out alot though. 

Avani Seminyak was a member only resort , I was told, which has recently been opened to the public and I would highly recommend these villas to honeymooners and families. 

The pool in the villas is 1.4 m deep and very satisfying for swimming and frolicking. The main pool opposite the reception has a very shallow end safe for toddlers. 

The airport pick up service was most convenient and available for midnight arrivals too. The free drop offs and pick ups to the beach was most convenient, and the staff would adjust the schedule to our timings when no other guests. 

Last but not the least, I praise the reservation staff who communicated regularly and helped arrange upgrades , airport transfers and baby-sitter well before we arrived.

Frankly, I admit to being a fussy traveller, but, no complaints here ！
title: We struck gold.

text:
The Anantara Vacation Club Seminyak is an extraordinary place to stay.  Although it is in the busy Seminyak area, it doesn’t feel that way, as it is tucked off the Main Street, walking distance to the restaurants and shopping but not in the middle of the noise and hassle and bustle.  The beach is a short walk away, although there is a shuttle there, there is really no reason to take it!  
I have to mention that the staff at the Anantara Vacation Club are the best and go above and beyond to make you feel special. The service is second to none. The food is excellent, and it is brought ot your room.  You can also eat in the restaurant, but most people eat in their villas.  I had breakfast every morning in my villa and the staff that bring the breakfast are friendly, professional, and make you feel special.  Everyone at the resort  really are exceptional. 

The Villas are very comfortable - I loved having my own pool, and used it morning and afternoon, and in the evening, I enjoyed having the small t.v. Room with the kitchenette to cool off before going to bed.  The bathrooms have an indoor and outdoor shower, and a very nice soaker bathtub that lets you look out into the private yard.  This felt like a luxury holiday and will definitely return.
I appreciated the birds in the morning, and the breeze.  I highly recommend this resort.
title: Home Away From Home

text:
Good location in Seminyak only a short walk to Seminyak Square one way and Frankensteins’s Laboratory and Bali Joe’s in the opposite direction.

Has a Circle K Supermarket about 50 metres from the entrance for all your supply needs.

Recommend the location to small families or couples who want a quiet location away from the busy streets but still want to be a short walk away from restaurants or entertainment area in Seminyak.

Only 1 Restaurant in the complex that is open for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner with full waiter service.

We experienced the breakfast during our stay which had nice food and well presented. We had the cooked breakfast option but they do have a continental breakfast option as well. 

(Please note they do not offer a buffet breakfast option).

There is a bar but you need to sit in the restaurant or chairs near the pool to drink or take back to your room.

They have a large pool at the front of the complex which has several shade huts to lay down on and relax by the pool.

There is a front desk which is staffed 24/7 to allow you to drop your keys off or order a taxi or seek visitor information or organise day tours.

They offer a free shuttle service to their sister hotel which is located on the beach in Seminyak and you can stay and use their facilities for the day if you spend a minimum of $25 per person at that hotel. (I guess a lunch or dinner or maybe drinks).

The beach is approx 5-10 mins drive away.

There is an abundance of sports bars and restaurants and eateries available all within a short walk.

There are also brand name shops around and small supermarkets.

Did not see many places to buy shirts or memorabilia etc like in Kuta where you need to barter.

We stayed in a 1 Bedroom Villa which accommodates 3 people - 1 king bed + Sofa Bed. You have access within your area of your own private plunge pool.

You do have a kitchenette with a microwave and medium size fridge should you wish to use.

The Villa is split into two areas with grass and plants between the rooms. The main room accommodates the main bedroom which has its own tv and DVD player with several wardrobes. You also have an ensuite which includes a deep bath, shower and toilet and outside shower.

The other area houses the kitchenette and a sofa (sofa bed) with another tv.

Both areas have ceiling fans and are air conditioned. 

There is also another toilet and shower adjacent to the other area which I believe is more designed to when you use the pool and don’t need to go through main bedroom to ensuite.

You have lay down chairs by the pool to relax.

There are no laundry in your villa however there is a guest laundry provided in the complex free of charge which has washing machines and dryers available for your use. 

You also have a limited gym available to use in the complex with weights and balls and other items.

The complex also provides 2 bedroom villas for the small families which we saw staying here.
title: Quiet location to relax and unwind

text: We stayed here as part of our Hilton Grand Vacation timeshare. From the moment we arrived to the day we departed, the staff here went above and beyond to make you feel comfortable and welcome. Probably the best staff I’ve ever had in all our travels. The villas were gorgeous and had everything you needed. Our own private pool was fabulous!  We were close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. I also loved the restaurant. Their fresh food and drinks were great. It was easy to get a driver for the day through Anantara. The drivers were very knowledgeable and worked with you to come up with an itinerary for the day. I’d like to also mention that one day my husband was not feeling well and we had to cancel dinner reservations that were made by reception. A short time later, wonderful chicken soup was delivered to our door. That type of service isn’t seen much these days. We can’t wait to go back next year!
title: Just As I Imagined Bali To Be

text: I stayed here in late May for 2 nights in a 1 bedroom pool villa.  The staff were friendly and helpful and the food in the restaurant enjoyable. It is not real close to the beach, but they run a free shuttle there and there are many great restaurants in the street the resort is on and also a main area 5 minutes walk away, with more restaurants, bars and a club.

text:
We stayed 4 nights in a 1 bedroom pool villa at the Anantara VC Seminyak. 

Location -
Initially, we had slight reservations with it being a little far from the beach, but the location turned out to be great for shopping and dining! The main shopping street Jln Kayu Aya is only an easy 10 min walk away, and Jln Raya Seminyak is also 10 min away (using small alleys). There are good food options along Jln Drupadi itself (Kilo, Zibiru, Lacalaca to name a few), and myriad of restaurants/cafes are not far away. Funny how we ended up not going to the beach at all, as the in-villa pool and main pool satisfied the kids' water-play needs...

Resort/villa setting - 
Everything about its common area (reception, main pool, restaurant) fits what I have come to expect from Anantara: beautiful, well, kept, with their tasteful signature decor. This is a small resort, with only 18 villa-rooms, so it has a nice cosy feel to it, especially with the service personnel's warmth. The guest laundry area was clean and the machines were in good condition for use (bring your own detergent). The pool villa we stayed in was equally beautiful, and well equipped with everything we need. The in-villa pool was small-ish, but sufficient for kids to play in and a light swim for adults. 

Service - 
Service was top class, from check-in, housekeeping, dining, to check-out. I particularly applaud how the staff took only 1 day to identify my family (surname) and the room we stay in. Perhaps the small resort lend to this, but still, good service. All staff were friendly, and always greet people as they walk past. The staff at the restaurant provided good and warm service whenever we had breakfast. 

Overall, a very enjoyable stay is a fantastic resort. We liked this a lot, and will surely stay here again. 

Highly recommended.
title: Beautiful & cosy, with great service

text:
Quite simply, this property is a real letdown to the Anantara brand.  

Overall ambience from lobby to pool to general grounds landscaping are at best comparable to the median, run of the mill 3* no brand property.  The so-called main pool is next to the lobby which is kinda bad resort design 101.  Location wasn't user friendly either - though it is within walking distance of Seminyak town it isn't all that close and there aren't really good shops or eateries nearby.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom pool villa, which didn't have a very user friendly layout.  The kitchenette, dining and living was housed in one small enclosure in the middle.  Somehow this made the whole place seem a lot more cramped than the sq ft would suggest as freedom of movement was restricted.  Bedrooms and toilets were reasonably spacious but not much decor and level of fittings were spartan.   

This is where I must say lies the real source of our disappointment.  I understand that Anantara bought over the property from a prior operator, so maybe not much can be done about structural stuff.  But c'mon guys please take more pride you HAVE to sweat the small stuff...the towels were rough, beds were hard and the kitchen did not even have a pair of scissors :)  To compound the already poor impression...WiFi was spotty, TV reception intermittent and daily amenities were not refilled (normally in a resort environment we would be more chilled out about these things but arrggh!).

In summary, the whole place just feels like dislocated as an Anantara property and we were frankly utterly shocked at the standards we experienced here.
title: "Avoid, far better value elsewhere"

text:
Having stayed at a number of Anantara properties, this one missed the mark of the luxurious experience most others provide.

Place is clean and staff is friendly. Facilities and restaurant options are limited in this small property.

The grand experience has gone lost in matters such as food offering, consistency of amenities available in the rooms, minimum number of towels available. Stains on linens, wear and tear if this fairly new property etc.

Nearest beach experience means going to Anantara Seminyak, where one can use the beach in front of the hotel where vendors frequently pass by trying to sell their merchandise.
Alternatively a family beach outing would cost USD100 for a family of 4 which is the minimum spend in F&B to be consumed at the hotel to use their facilities.
title: Good intentions but missing the luxury one expects from Anantara

owner_response.text:
Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to share on Tripadvisor your feedback regarding your recent stay at Anantara Vacation Club Bali Seminyak. 

It is only through feedback such as this that we are able to continually review the facilities and services we provide to ensure that they meet our guests' expectations at all times. 

I was disappointed to read that you were not entirely satisfied with your experience here at Anantara Vacation Club and I would like to apologise for any inconvenience caused. 

It is true that the concept for the property in Bali is very different to the one in Phuket and Samui. We have gone with a smaller, more boutique style that offers a very high level of privacy & personalised service. Some owners prefer the bigger style of hotel that we offer in Phuket & Samui. The Bali property is really aimed at owners who want to get away from it all and enjoy real peace and quiet in the privacy of their villas.

I was surprised that you raised concerns regarding the provision of amenities and linen. I was aware that you were not entirely satisfied with the scent of the body lotion and a new one was purchased immediately to replace the one in your villa. I was not aware of any other complaints.

If there were shortfalls in the amenities and linen, this should most definately not have been the case and I will look in to this with the team. My sincere apologies for any inconvenience caused.

It is true that AVC Bali is not on the beach front and as a result we have arranged it so that AVC guests may use the facilities of our sister hotel with minimum spend on food and beverage of USD 25 per person. Beach chairs can also be rented on the public beach for around USD 10 per day per person but this will not include the 5 star service available at the Anantara Seminyak.

We would love to have you come and stay with us again. Please feel free to contact me directly at jsweeneylowe@anantaraclub.com should I be able to assist you in any way in the future.

Kind regards,
Jonathan

I was surprised that you did not enjoy the resort location. Many owners really appreciate the central location of the resort with so much shopping and restaurants to choose from and only a few minutes walk to the beach. There are also many spas to choose from right next to the resort.

It is true that we are not a beach front property, however we do offer a shuttle service 3 times daily to the Anantara Seminyak, where Vacation Club guests can use the beach lawn & pool facilities with a minimum spend on food & beverage of USD 25 per adult. Alternatively, we can organise sun chairs on the public beach for USD 10 per day.

It is disappointing to read that you did not enjoy the breakfast. We believe that for USD 12 the offering is both sufficient and of good value. Furthermore, regarding activities, we have an extensive selection for both children and adults. I would be happy to forward you the details if you wish.

If you would like to discuss further, please feel free to contact me directly at jsweeneylowe@anantaraclub.com should I be able to assist you in any way in the future.

Kind regards,
Jonathan

text:
I chose this resort because of atrractive package cost offered by bank promotion, compare to Anantara group hotels, this resort may be not in line with it, but still is an amazing and good place to stay.  Honestly, if they charge me market rate, this may not be my choice, but considering the promotion price, this is worthy.

I just want to say something good about this resort, since I read many negative comments from trip advisor, but my experience is:

1) private pool is definitely clean, there are some flower seeds or leafs on it, but this is definitely normal and acceptable, I saw how the housekeeping clean it on the 2nd day, they brush the pool and clear up all the floating leafs every day, so I was so enjoying the private pool during my stay.

2) toilet is clean, not smelly, enough hot water, I spent half hour to take shower and shampoo, still have hot water supply.

3) mosquito problem, I think this happens in Bali, not just Anantara. Nevertheless, I appreciate what Anantara has done to eliminate this, they have a memo tip in room to remind you how to stay away from mosquitoes, they provide mosquitoes spray in both bedroom and living room, also they regulary spray insects repeller inside hotel.  I think Anantara is really considering guest experience so they do a lot to tackle this problem.

4) staff service is excellent, very helper, nice and polite, reponse quickly.

5) even the last room you stay, it's not really far awy from the lobby, since the scale of the resort is relatively smaller than chain resort and those I travelled before (some resorts may need to drive a golf car to the lobby), so it is not necessary to request any room near lobby.

Lastly, I didn't purchase their package after listening their 90 mins preview, in fact, I spent 2.5 hours to it, cos I do interested in it and seems appealing to me, their salesperson was still nice even I declined it.
title: Ever better than we expect

text:
This was our 3rd Bali visit. We planned this visit after  we got this invitation from Anantara Vacation Club to experience and enroll. We were in a 2 beedroom Villa. 

This place is in a remote part of Seminyak, far away from the beach and  about a 10 m walk to the Seminyak  market with loads of food options. Suited us fine, staying in SEA we have a little too much of beaches anyway. This place is close to Ke de ta, Rock Bar, Potato Head so the night life is taken care of...One thing that irked me was the road that led to the market, it was dimly lit and we saw a snatching right in front of us so we were super careful. 

About the Villa itself… we can find no major faults… yes the bedrooms are not connected and that’s the charm of it…. The glass living area in the middle was beautiful...The pool is lovely, people have complained that they were dirty but no its just the leaves that fall in the night. You can call the staff and promptly someone comes and cleans it. They have only one restaurant – not the best food but  passable, but there are plenty of choices at a 20-30 m walk. The rooms/ décor / amenities are fantastic!!! But we have stayed in Anantara resorts before... this though is lovely, don't expect similar amenities... These villas were fantastic but unlike the other anantara do not have the sea view or the rated restaurants... but they also don't charge you the other one's rates.

There are a few key drawbacks… First in the Villa the sunken tub is a hazard especially for families with kids… we told our toddler that it’s a dry pool and she didn’t go anywhere near it. Second is that this place is dimly lit so in the evenings if your villa is at the end then walking on the cobbled path is not too nice. Ours was the first villa so we didn’t have any issues. Finally the entrance is a narrow pathway, for one car only, so if you are driving it’s a major irritant.
Now if one is wondering if we bought the package- the answer is no… but we were really tempted. If they pushed us enough we would have bought it… but we did the math and it didn’t really add up so we resisted the temptation. 
We have stayed later at a different Anantara resort and again tempted to most likely signup next year---- Lets see
title: Lovely Villas - But poor cousins of Anantara Resorts

text:
With the credit card offer for the Anantara Vacation Club membership, we've booked 3 nights pool villa with AVC.

Upon arrival, we were being welcomed by very friendly staff. And were quite impressed with the exterior of our villa when we stepped in, as this is our first villa experience.

Yet, after we settled down in our room, we discovered:
(1) small tiny bugs jumping on our bed; 
(2) the toilet ware and bath tub a bit worn off and doesnt look very clean
(3) the toilet bowl a bit smelly
(4) our private pool seems to be covered with dust and dead bugs which was not very appealing for us to get in and swim
(5) At night, we found the room a bit dark even we switched on the light
(6) the biggest problem is the bug mosquitos almost everywhere in our room and bathroom, even we didnt open our door at all throughout the day; we were being waken by the mosquitos at night and my eye lid got swollen after the second night, with my arms and legs got bitten

At first we planned to spend most of our time to enjoy the villa, turned out we stayed most of the time outside our villa to avoid the bugs.

We are reqired to join a 90 min presentation in the morning about their super expensive vacation club membership. I am amused that they compared themselves with Bayan Tree's USD 150K club membership. Anyway, we expected that and were quite firmed with our decision prior to that, so the experience not as bad as I thought.

All in all, it is a good deal for our stay given the low promotion rates for the AVC membership trial. Yet, I wont see myself returning if I have to pay the normal rates, given there are plenty better elsewhere.
title: Slightly disappointed

text:
My husband and I stayed in the Private Pool Villa, here's our experience:

Villa Experiences: 
1) We had to changed to another villa on our second day, which was very inconvenience considering we unpacked everything.  Why did we changed to another villa?  Here are the reasons:
a) There was no lights in the bathroom and shower
b) There were no shampoo in the shower
c) At 7am the next morning there were construction worker banging on the roof and woke us up
d) Well to be in a Private Pool Villa, you would at expect privacy right?  Whoops!  I had 3 construction men watching me going to the toilet, shower and basically I was EXPOSED to the 3 men.

2) After I complained, they changed room for us.  Which we thought was 'much better'... but it didn't end there... after the 'better villa', the following issues still exists:
a) The shower and toilet was actually disgustingly old and dirty
b) Hot water only runs 20 mins, if you want to take a bath in the bath tub, good luck, as it didn't work for us... took 20 mins for the tub to be half full... then had to wait another 20 or so minute for hot water to 'return' but of cos by then the original half tub was cold already!
c) The pool is dirty and super small, put it clearly, we did not even step out feet inside that dirty pool!

Services:
a) Well the services was of cos not up to any other 'resort' standard.  For breakfast, there were only one waiter, meaning wait wait wait and wait...
b) To think they would have a Spa in this Villa, well, sorry there's none.  But to our surprise, NO ONE had given us the Anantara Spa Menu (which is 3 mins by car) at their other resort, but rather gave us some doggy local salon/spa.  We ended up exploring other spa outside ourselves.
c) Well, they asked us for our flight schedule prior to our stay.  I booked around 4.5 months in advanced, but a very simple request of 'late check-out' just to match our flight schedule could NOT be entertained!?! What a joke!  We are not asking alot, just check-out at 1pm could not be entertained.

ADDITIONAL "UNEXPECTED" EXPERIENCE:
a) We came across this resort due to some promotion.  We had to listen to their vacation club membership programme for 90 mins.  My husband and I was in fact interested in it and asked many questions, which the 90 mins became 2.5 hrs.  Well, the membership they initially tried to sell us was just under USD100,000 (by installment), then the sales manager came and tried to closed the selling with a membership of under USD60,000.  To be very honest, my husband and I was seriously considering.  All we asked was for us to go back to our room and discuss tonight and give them the decision the next day.  (Considering we are staying at the resort, we can't go anywhere right?)   Well... typical 'closed door' sales... immediately when we say we need to consider and get back to them... they literally changed their attitude to "BLACK FACE" and closed their file ready to send us off?!?!?! What type of sales is that?  I mean we are talking about a ready buyer who actually just want one night to consider which option is better and we weren't allowed to? 
b) So what happened next?  They had a 'service-check gal' come into the room after the two 'disappointment sales left the room'.  She seems abit better and said we can try out their system with only around USD2000 trial fee, my husband and I thought it was very reasonable and said we will seriously consider, but we still want to confirm her the day after.  What was the answer?  No again! 
c) In conclusion, honestly, my husband and I was seriously consider buying the membership if only they weren't so hard sell and forced one-time closed.  If they let us consider, I actually am quite confident we would take up the offer as we travel lots anyway and it seems like a reasonable membership scheme.

So what happened next?
- We were informed immediately after the 'sales presentation' by the reception that our "ONE HR" initially agreed late check-out was rejected. 

This seriously was the WORST EVER EXPERIENCE I had ever had with a holiday.  
I never really write much reviews or comments, but this experience I feel like I must share with the public and do the society some good by warning you all 'what you will expect'.
title: The WORST Experience at a so call 'resort'

We stayed at the pool villa for 3 nights and this is one of the worst resort/room that I have ever encountered. The problem starts as soon as we stepped into our room. The pool water was greenish and lots of leaves and branches in it. Then our air-con was not cold. When the engineering tool out the filters,  they were black...full of dusts. Then the TV reception was poor and we have to change room after nearly 1 hour trouble shooting in the room.

The villa layout is the worst. The bedroom is in 1 room and you have  another room for the sitting and kitchen. The 2 rooms are located at one end to another. It is so inconvenient. When we order room service, we have to walk and dine in  the kitchen/living room. It is truly a bad design. 

Breakfast only comes in a set. You have to pay for additional cup of coffee or juice. Food was terrible. However, our room service dinner and lunch were pretty good and thats the only consolation. Apart from that, this hotel has nothing to offer. Dont waste your time.

We stayed in Suite 15 and found that the pool was dirty when we arrived. None of the 3 airconds were working properly and probably had not been serviced for sometime. We had to inform the front desk about the airconds and to be fair this was rectified promptly. 

When ordering dinner at night do be prepared to wait for your meals. The staff are really trying their best but they are quite thin on the ground.

On the plus side the staff are friendly and do try their very best. Meals are up to scratch although we ate quite a bit in the Resort which is a short taxi ride away.

On the whole AVC Bali is definitely not as good as Phuket.

text:
The villas is poorly design and not well maintain:-

- Each villa is attached to each other, so you can hear somebody next door or at the corridor talking clearly; especially I am living at room 8 next to the laundry room 
- The show is broken, and the water comes out from the side of the tube
- The shampoo container is not working well, which makes my wife thinks it is a empty bottle
- Looks like that the toothbrush has been used by somebody else and the toothpaste is only half full
- The sliding door is very heavy to open - when you go to the kitchen from the room, you have to open and close at least two times!
- The pool is dirty. No cleansing for long time! I would rather to swim at the large public pool - then what's the point to have a private pool

The location is far away from the beach and shop, and in fact the entrance is extremely small and most taxi drivers have never heard of this property and easy to miss.

However the service quality is pretty high and very responsive.  The in house restuarant is another plus to this property, I have tried almost everything on the menu and the taste is well above Bali average.

I realize Anantara Vacation Club properties are sub-standard product - at least for this and Phuket one.  I have visited another Anantara at Seminyak which is 5 minutes drive away and seems that one is a better option as it is along the beach front - and I dont mind it is not villa type.
title: Poor Villa Design

text:
We checked in Garden pool villa for 3 days & found service was exemplary.
Breakfast in restaurant was good but had limited options.
Villa , however seemed infested with mosquitoes & ensuring a hassle free sleep at night seemed difficult.Kitchenette was away from room & travelling between rooms; especially at night- was annoying.

A pamphlet in our room mentioned Geckos could be seen within the property & they were friendly. In pamphlets, visitors were encouraged to click pictures when they spotted a gecko to win a gecko soft toy. Brilliant trick but still didn't go down well with us! 

Taxi was must as place is far from market & beach.

Average experience as Bali seems to have better alternatives with significantly better value.
title: Great service but mosquito infested

text: Originally booked a 1 bedroom villa with a friend but were upgraded to a 2-bedroom as the resort was under renovation and not fully booked at the time. The rooms were extremely comfortable and spacious. The villa was spotless. The outdoor shower, sunken bath, private plunge pool and amenities made us feel very pampered. I loved how we could either keep the doors closed and chill to the AC or open the living room/dining/kitchen sliding doors and jump directly into the pool from there. Service was prompt and food requests came within 15-20mins of calling. The only downside was that the location itself was not too great. Far from the beach (although there is a shuttle available to take you to the other Anantara property. Ideal would have been if the two were connected) and not near many of the shops and restaurants that made inland Bali properties worth it. That said, staff was always ready to call you a cab, or shuttle, or even the resort golf cart if you were too lazy to walk from the dining area to your villa.
title: Lovely Villas, but far from the beach and most shops

text:
When we first walked into our 2 bedroom pool villa we were stunned by its beautiful Balinese style and atmosphere. Both bedrooms and the living room were equipped with a ceiling fan and air conditioner that made our stay very pleasant, or alternatively the sliding doors allowed for a modern open plan living experience. My friend and I absolutely loved waking up in the morning and starting our day with a refreshing swim among the frangipani trees and room service with a smile if we desired. 

The staff here are amazing, always answering our calls promptly from the room and offering their services for any bookings or housekeeping needs. Our rooms were always refreshed with clean towels and amenities including bottled water, tea and coffee. 

We were more than satisfied with our stay at anantara vacation club and would happily stay here again.
title: The ultimate villa experience

owner_response.text:
Dear Ms. Bea,

I was delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and so pleased that you took time to share this with Tripadvisor’s readers. In particular it was pleasing to read that you enjoyed staying in one of our two bedroom villas which are ideal for families or friends travelling together.

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I couldn't agree more with the most recent review given on this property.  It isn't suitable for a family with young children. We travelled in 5 pax and this includes one toddler and an infant .  We stayed in a one-bedroom pool villa.
The biggest downside to this property is the separation of the living room / kitchen from the bedroom.  When it rains ( 5 straight rain- pouring days out of our 6-day stay) having to travel between the 2 rooms is extremely annoying.  Constantly opening and closing doors not only meant inconvenience, also risked mosquitoes invasion, frog or lizard coming to the room .
The second foremost downside is the kitchen.  Poor design, limited bench space, can't even fit a plate on the benchtop. There's also no dining sets or a designated place for dining. There's one small table and chair so each person has to take turns eating.  The other downsides are the deep sunken bath (dangerous for kids), one washing machine to be shared by 18 families (when full house), poor functioning air conditioner, and poor location.  You can walk for around 15-20 min to reach some real shops but the walk is unpleasant. The road is narrow so cars or motorcycles will splash water on you from the puddles.
The only upside to this place is the service, it is a 6 star service.  Despite being fully booked, the service is extremely prompt and accommodating. We made quite a lot of requests from housekeeping, each time our requests were received with smiles and patience, and items were delivered within 5 minutes .Staff members were extremely friendly n helpful.
Our stay has been unpleasant due to the extreme poor weather and disappointment with the room itself, but the excellent service and helpful staffs made our day everyday.
The rating of Poor is given based on the price of this accommodation vs what it has to offer. Disregarding the price, it would deserve an Average rating.
title: Poor room layout, design and location but a 6-star service

text:
Stayed for a week with 7 pax with a mix family profile of grandparents, a toddler, an infant.

Stayed in a 2-bedroom villa near to the entrance/deli. Was initially worried about possible noise from outside, but it was very private. It is also near the gym and laundry area (villa 5). It is also near the main pool which has a children shallow pool area. This is good for us as the pool villa does not have area suitable for young children. 

Villa design is not suitable for families with young children. There are three main buildings/wings separated by outdoor space. Two bedrooms are to the east and west of the kitchen/living room. So, when it is raining heavily, we will have to carry an umbrella when we commute between rooms or we will be struggling to juggle carrying several items (eg an active infant and milk bottles) while opening and closing doors. It was also dangerous to leave our children (infant & toddler) sleeping in the bedroom alone and rest/watch TV in the kitchen as it is too far away to hear any cries. The toliet is also dangerous for young children as it has a deep sunken bathtub where they can walked into it easily. The design is more suited for couples rather than families with young children. 

Was also disappointed to find out that it had a common laundry area with only one washing machine and two dryers. Spent half a day doing laundry for 7 pax. It didn't help that there was a power trip and we had to restart the cycle. So do bring sufficient clothes. Was probably spoilt by other anantara vacation club facilities in Thailand where there is in-villa 2 in 1 washing machines and we could just throw our laundry into the machine and travel out. 

Service was excellent. All staff were very professional and  friendly. They were also very prompt in repairs when given feedback. I also enjoyed the refreshing cold water served when we go to the common pool.

For service. I only have issues with the quota of two 1.5L drinking water bottles per villa, which is very challenging for 7 people (including two milk drinking children). On good days, I could get 3 bottles after 'begging' for more. Anyway, we had to buy much more on our own. I just felt that they could ration the water according to the number of people living in a villa, rather than just standard 2 bottles per villa.

Deli food was tasty and nice. It is reasonably priced at around 100k to 150k for each main. For cheaper options, you can just take a short walk just outside (restaurant selling pizza, pasta and local food). There is also a mini mart just outside.

There are 3 shuttle timings to go to the beach club starting at 10am which is very hot at the beach. We called a cab to go there earlier in the morning for around 25k. It was cheap and recommended if you want to avoid the afternoon sun. Beach club for AVC is a good 5-10 min walk from drop off point and only comprise of 4 beach seats and an outdoor shower. We decided it was not worth the walk there but rather pay for the facilities nearer to the drop off point. 

Generally, feel that AVC in seminyak is more suitable for couples instead of young or large families.
title: Great service but facilities not suitable for families with young children

text: After being pampered from other Anantara Properties, this one is really very disappointing. Firstly this property is invaded by mosquitoes. I stayed for 4 days but i don't see any fogging on mosquitoes. Adults being bitten by mosquitoes is still bearable but not for kids. The room lights are very dim and the room aircon is under designed.The bathroom is a sauna with no ceiling fans or aircon. But one plus point is the F&B which does serve good food. The staff is very experience and friendly.
title: Below expectation for this Anantara Property

text:
アナンタラ・バケーション・クラブのヴィラですが、かつてはラナディヴィラという名称だったようですね。
プーケットのゴージャスなアナンタラを垣間見ているので、やや年季が入ったこぢんまりした建物と小さなプライベートプールはちょっと期待外れでしたが、一番の問題はそこではありませんでした。カビ臭です。
初日の夜、お風呂に入るときに換気扇をつけたのですが、その途端ものすごい異臭が。慌ててスイッチを切ったものの異臭は消えず、カビが原因だと思われたので大変気分が悪くなりました。
部屋の移動を頼めば良かったのですが、夜で疲れているし荷解きもしているし、ホテルと違って部屋数の少ないヴィラに空き部屋があるとは限らないし、いろいろ交渉するのが面倒だし、換気扇を使わなければ大丈夫かもと思って我慢してしまったのは、こちらの落ち度でもあります。
結局、異臭はその後も残り、不快な気分のままでした。これが一番のマイナス点です。
もう一つのマイナス点はミミズです。気付かないままベッド周りで３匹踏み潰しました。シャワーサンダルを履いていたのは不幸中の幸いです。
南国ではあり建物の構造上仕方ないと思えるし、個人的にミミズの類はへっちゃらなので、その程度のちん入者は笑い話で済ませられますが、汁気たっぷりの環形動物が足の裏でプチッと潰れる感触にはゾッとして飛び上がりました。
プラス点はスタッフが礼儀正しく感じ良かったこと、レストランの食事がおいしかったこと、初バリを楽しめる好立地だったことです。
title: マイナス点とプラス点

しかし、スタッフの対応もよく快適に過ごせました。
title: ゆったり快適

text: ビーチまで遠くて、シャトルバスの便も少なくて使いにくいと聞いていましたが、部屋のプールで満足できるくらいの二人組でしたので、一度だけビーチに行くときにシャトルを利用し、帰りは散策がてら歩いて帰りました。日傘代わりにホテルの傘を１本持って出ましたが、散策していたら乾季なのに雨が降ってきました。歩いたおかげで安いマッサージ屋さん（一時間５万ルピー）を見つけ利用したり、食事をしたり買い物を楽しみました。反対方面のスミニャックスクエアの方にも歩いて出かけ買い物を楽しみました。ビンタンスーパーマーケットには初日で土地勘もなくタクシーで行きましたが、行きは定額の３００円くらい、帰りはメーターでしたので１７０円くらいだったようでタクシーは安いです。歩いて行ける範囲でショッピングや食事が楽しめるので、私たちにはよかったです。施設自体は自炊もできる設備は整っていたので良かったです。心配する程蚊もいなくて、備え付けの蚊取り線香は到した日だけしか使いませんでした。掃除も毎日私たちが出かけているときに入ってくださっていました。リクエストを書き置きしておいたら自炊用の水もたっぷりおいてくださっていました。残念ながらＷｉ-Ｆｉはうまくつながらず（パスワードを教えてもらったものの。私たちの技術が未熟なせいもあるのかも）ラインができずじまいで残念でした。
title: 思ったより快適
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text: Начну с того что  на Бали был три раза. Очень люблю эту страну. Отдых клубный впарили мне  в Таиланде на Пхукете. Забронировать хотел Анантару на    Самуи, но мест на ближайшие 4-5 месяцев не было.Решили полететь на Бали. Забронировали неделю Анантару по баллам и пять ночей в Убуде.В Анантара был в нескольких отелях на Мальдивах и цепочка мне очень понравилась.Но на Бали меня разочаровал отель, вернее клубный отдых.Виллы достаточно большие и уютные, расположение не очень хорошее в 700 м от пляжа, территории как таковой в отеле нет. В целом отдых на 3 балла.
title: Бали, рай но не везде.

text:
入住别墅套房，设施完善，私密性很好，干净，整洁。员工非常nice，工作效率很高。提供机场接送服务。
早餐一般，交通略有不变。水明漾的交通拥堵很严重。

text:
1）早三個月訂房但已經沒有一房villa, 但因為買了機票，唯有貴了住兩房villa, 很不開心！
2）身為會員但入住時不包括早餐是很差的體驗！很不滿意！
3）身為會員在生日月份入住酒店但一點優惠也沒有！差！
4）浴室內花灑縣掛地方太矮，雨淋式花灑又太高，水壓又超低，差到不得了！
5）床上的枕頭有異味！
6）浴缸貯不到水！
7）兩間房的洗手盆去水位的塞都是壞的！
title: 對待會員太差，但員工服務很好！

text: 外面的道路很小，酒店也不大，但是比较精致。别墅的感觉不错，就是内部的泳池有落叶什么的没有清理好，和前一天另外一家酒店的别墅清洁度有差距，即使服务生说他们每天都清洗。

partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text: 入住体验超好 特别是入住时负责接待我们的服务员 由于自己的英语水平很烂 他就亲自带着我走遍了酒店能够提供的所有服务设施并详细解说 包括洗衣机和烘干机的使用方法 进入房间后 也是详细解释了每样设施的使用及有关规定 真是太贴心了
title: 超级好的酒店
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text: 规模不大，只有18栋别墅，多数为单卧室别墅，所以大一点的家庭很难预定上双卧室别墅，三卧室别墅就更少了。进入别墅的道路很狭窄，悠长，基本上就属于单向通道，车一多进出人一多几乎拥堵。别墅附近不太繁华，好在距离水明漾广场和商业街不算太远。门口有OK便利店24小时还算基本满足需求，15分钟路程到COCO超市，货品较全，且早上11点前还有7折的HAPPY HOURS，20分钟车程可以到家乐福。早餐不是自助式的，且每天都是单一品种，没有什么选择余地。3岁以下的小孩子还需要付费想用早餐，虽然给了儿童折扣，但是任然觉得不如其他品牌酒店。别墅距离沙滩较远，只有固定班次沙滩摆渡车，很可惜居然不是随叫随到的摆渡车，到安娜塔拉水明漾酒店，同样没有儿童俱乐部，很是不可思议，怎么针对家庭度假提供服务呢？还好别墅有提供给会员的玩具可以取回别墅共度一晚。
title: 位于水明漾的有私家泳池的别墅
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text: 酒店设施及服务人员态度都很棒，很友善。对于需求能在第一时间满足。有私人的游泳池和厨房，可以享受更多的私人空间。
title: 享受不一样的度假经历
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text:
酒店較想像中細，車子要穿過一條窄窄長長的車道，才能到達酒店大堂，酒店只得18間房，較細。

房間的燈光不足，比較暗，如需要在晚上閱讀，或會有點困難。冷氣機的吹風口吹正床，幸好有蚊帳阻隔，才好一點。洗手間的木門較舊，關閉時明顯看到虛位。沖涼時熱水不足，如需要浸浴，便較麻煩。早上時泳池的水揼很嘈，會影響休息。

中午想留位在晚上吃燭光晚餐，卻說要早一天預訂，非常不便。

酒店的員工十分有禮，效率亦高。餐廳的食物質素好，留在酒店吃飯也不錯
title: 酒店較想像中細
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text:
初めてのバリ訪問でこちらを利用しました。
今までのアナンタラの訪問先が良かっただけにスミニャクの施設には少しがっかりしました。
2ベッドルームビラと１ベッドルームビラに宿泊しましたが、最初に宿泊した2ベッドルームはお風呂のお湯が途中で出なくなったり、雨期であったせいでもありますが、バスルームの天井から雨漏りしたり、2年前にリノベーションしたとは思えない設備の老朽化が激しかったです。
昨年、同時期に利用したプーケットのプールビラが素晴らしかっただけに残念でした。
スタッフのサービスはアナンタラクオリティで素晴らしかっただけに残念です。

また、アナンタラのスミニャクとは離れた（ビーチから離れた）位置にあり、シャトルも一日3回しか利用できないし、スミニャクのホテルとの連携も無いようでした。
スミニャクのにぎやかな雰囲気を楽しみたいなら良いですが、ゆっくりするのであれば、プーケットの方がずっと良いと思いました。反面、プーケットに比べれば、近くにたくさん食事やショッピングができるところが多いので、便利ではありましたが、クルマとバイクの多さには閉口します。

次回、バリを訪問するのであれば、ウルワツのアナンタラを試してみようと思います。
title: アナンタラとしては・・・

text: 升级为2 bedrooms的豪华Villa后，很舒适。蚊子很多，度假村有配备蛮管用的药水和电蚊香。泳池很棒。度假村不大，只有18栋Villa，但是安静。雨季需要戴着雨伞出门。最好的是有洗衣房，烘干衣服很方便。健身房几乎没人使用。
title: 满意的享受

text: プライベートプール付きで部屋にキッチンも備わった、ぜいたくなヴィラという内容に魅かれ泊まってみました。ただスミニャックの裏通りという土地柄がそうなのでしょうか。部屋に蚊が絶えず飛んで来ます。備え付けの蚊取り線香と虫除けスプレーで何とか対処したものの、滞在中は終始、部屋の窓を思いきり開け放つことができず、それがストレスでした。ベッドの丁度良い固さを始め寝室の居心地も良く、バスタブも広々としていて快適で、客室の使い勝手は大変良いし、スタッフの接客態度も親切かつ真面目で好印象なだけに、余計に蚊のことが気になりました。最初は遠慮がちに使っていた虫除けスプレーも、なりふりかまわず、カーテンやらベッド周りにかけまくり、エアコンの温度設定も思いきり低くして寝たら、睡眠中に刺されずにすみました。なお、ラナディヴィラというの名前は今使われておらず、アナンタラバケーションクラブが現名称です。アナンタラグループならではの特典ということでしょうか、車で３～４分位の場所にある同系列のアナンタラスミニャックバリリゾート＆スパまで無料の送迎サービスが１日三回あります。海岸に面したリゾートへの送迎なので、海で遊んだりビーチ周辺で食事するための移動に便利でした。１日三回と言わず１時間間隔にでも設定してくれたらもっと利用したと思います。
title: 蚊さえ気にならなければ
